SourceText: Their arms and legs come in pairs. Count them by counting by 2's.
text: 他們的手臂和腿是成對的。成對數一數它們。

SourceText: How do the number of arms compare to the number of legs?
text: 手臂的數量與腿的數量相比, 哪個更多？

SourceText: What is better, city life or village life?
text: 城市生活和鄉村生活哪個更好？

SourceText: How do the number of girls compare to the number of boys?
text: 女孩的數量與男孩的數量相比，誰更多？

SourceText: If you combine the three girls with the three boys, how many children are there? What is three more than three?
text: 如果把三個女孩和三個男孩加起來，有幾個孩子？三加三等於多少？

SourceText: Instead of counting them as three plus three more, count them by 2's and see if you get the same number.
text: 不要將它們數為三加三，試試成對數，看看能不能得到相同的數字。

SourceText: A rainbow has seven colors.
text: 彩虹有七種顏色。

SourceText: Count together the colors of the rainbow.
text: 一起數一數彩虹的顏色。

SourceText: Have you ever seen a rainbow after it rains? Sometimes, you can even see a double rainbow if you're lucky!
text: 你曾經在雨後見過彩虹嗎？有時候，如果你幸運的話，甚至能看到雙彩虹！

SourceText: Point out that her dress and the background on this page go through many of the same colors as the rainbow.
text: 指出她的衣服和這一頁的背景中有許多與彩虹相同的顏色。

SourceText: The first color is red.
text: 第一種顏色是紅色。

SourceText: How does the color red make you feel? Red is often thought of as an active, high energy color.
text: 紅色讓你有什麼感覺？紅色通常被認為是一種充滿活力、能量很高的顏色。

SourceText: Sometimes red is an angry color. People may say they "see red" when they are angry.
text: 有時候，紅色是一種憤怒的顏色。人們可能會在憤怒時說他們「看到紅色」。

SourceText: People often paint things red or choose red things because of the color's high energy. Have you seen cars that are red?
text: 因為這種顏色的高能量，人們經常把事物塗成紅色或選擇紅色的物品。你見過紅色的汽車嗎？

SourceText: Kewyu is wearing a red shirt.
text: 科由穿著一件紅色的襯衫。

SourceText: Do you have any red clothes?
text: 你有紅色的衣服嗎？

SourceText: Do you have any red flowers near where you live?
text: 你住的地方附近有紅色的花嗎？

SourceText: Count together the number of people in this picture.
text: 一起數一數這張圖片中有多少人。

SourceText: The second color is orange.
text: 第二種顏色是橙色。

SourceText: How does orange feel compared to red? It is still high energy, but perhaps a bit less so.
text: 橙色相對於紅色有什麼感覺？它仍然充滿活力，但可能稍微減弱了一些。

SourceText: She looks all alone in the middle of all that orange with her hands stretched out like that.
text: 她在那一片橙色中像那樣伸出雙手看起來很孤獨。

SourceText: An orange is a fruit named after its color. Can you think of other orange things around you?
text: 橙子是一種以顏色命名的水果。你能想到你周圍還有哪些橙色的東西嗎？

SourceText: This is an orange. What else can you see that is the color orange?
text: 這是一個橙子。你還能看到其他是橙色的東西嗎？

SourceText: The cat and fish are orange. Have you seen an orange cat or fish before?
text: 貓和魚是橙色的。你以前見過橙色的貓或魚嗎？

SourceText: A sphere is a ball -- round in all directions. Is an orange a sphere?
text: 一個球體是一個球形的物體 —— 在所有方向上都是圓的。橙子是一個球體嗎？

SourceText: How is the fish bowl different from a sphere?
text: 魚缸和一個球體有什麼不同？

SourceText: The third color is yellow.
text: 第三種顏色是黃色。

SourceText: Make up something that she is pointing at.
text: 編造一個她正在指向的東西。

SourceText: She looks excited about what is coming next. I bet it is something yellow!
text: 她看起來對接下來的事情感到興奮。我打賭那是一些黃色的東西！

SourceText: How has her dress changed from earlier pictures? Hint: It is now broken up into two sections.
text: 她的裙子與之前的圖片相比有什麼變化？提示：現在分成了兩個部分。

SourceText: The yolk of an egg is yellow. What else can you see that is the color yellow?
text: 雞蛋的蛋黃是黃色的。你還能看到其他是黃色的東西嗎？

SourceText: How can you tell that she is hungry?
text: 你怎麼知道她餓了？

SourceText: She has a yellow sunflower on her table. Do you have flowers around you sometimes when you eat?
text: 她的桌子上有一朵黃色的向日葵。你在吃飯的時候周圍有時也有花嗎？

SourceText: Name something in the sky that is yellow.
text: 說出天空中的一樣黃色的東西。

SourceText: The fourth color is green.
text: 第四種顏色是綠色。

SourceText: How does green feel to you? This green is a lot calmer than the red, orange, or yellow.
text: 綠色對你來說是什麼感覺？這種綠色比紅色、橙色或黃色要平靜得多。

SourceText: Name some things that are green -- they are all around you!
text: 說出一些是綠色的東西——它們都在你周圍！

SourceText: Green comes in many different types. How many types of green can you name?
text: 綠色有很多不同的種類。你能說出多少種綠色？

SourceText: Our banana garden is green.
text: 我們的香蕉園是綠色的。

SourceText: Point at and count the animals you see on this page -- look carefully!
text: 指出並數一數你在這頁上看到的動物 —— 仔細看！

SourceText: Point out the yellow greens, lime greens, bright greens, and dark greens on this page.
text: 指出這頁上的黃綠色、石灰綠色、明亮綠色和深綠色。

SourceText: A lot of trees are brown and green. Brown is not one of the main colors of the rainbow. Where does it show up in the rainbow?
text: 很多樹都是褐色和綠色的。褐色不是彩虹的主要顏色之一。它會在彩虹中的哪個位置出現？

SourceText: The fifth color is blue.
text: 第五種顏色是藍色。

SourceText: She looks so happy in the middle of all that blue. Does blue make you feel happy?
text: 她在那一片藍色中看起來很開心。藍色讓你感到快樂嗎？

SourceText: Some people say they feel blue when they are sad. Does blue seem like a sad color to you?
text: 有些人說當他們感到悲傷時，他們感到"藍色"。對你來說，藍色是否似乎是一種悲傷的顏色？

SourceText: The sky and water are usually blue, but it is not common in plants. Have you seen flowers that are blue?
text: 天空和水通常是藍色的，但在植物中並不常見。你見過藍色的花嗎？

SourceText: The sky is blue.
text: 天空是藍色的。

SourceText: Bodies of water, such as oceans, seas, lakes, and rivers, are often blue.
text: 水體，如海洋、海域、湖泊和河流，通常是藍色的。

SourceText: Point to these birds and clouds and count them together.
text: 指著這些鳥和雲，一起數一數。

SourceText: Which are there more of -- clouds or birds?
text: 雲和鳥哪個更多？

SourceText: The sixth color is indigo.
text: 第六種顏色是靛藍。

SourceText: Flowers are sometimes indigo. Have you seen flowers whose color is close to being indigo?
text: 有時花朵是靛藍的。你見過顏色接近靛藍的花嗎？

SourceText: Sometimes her hands are stretched out wide. Having hands on hips often shows defiance and strength.
text: 有時她的雙手會伸得很寬。雙手叉腰通常顯示出反抗和力量。

SourceText: Indigo is very powerful. How do you feel if you stare at this big square of indigo?
text: 靛藍是非常強烈的顏色。如果你盯著這塊大的靛藍色正方形，你會有什麼感覺？

SourceText: These berries are the color indigo.
text: 這些漿果是靛藍色的。

SourceText: Count together the buttons or snaps on her jacket.
text: 一起數一數她夾克上的鈕扣或按扣。

SourceText: Would you like to eat some of those berries? Do you think you could eat all of them?
text: 你想吃一些這些漿果嗎？你覺得你能把它們吃光嗎？

SourceText: Think of the largest number you can. Does she have more berries than that number?
text: 想一想你能想到的最大的數字。她有比那個數字更多的漿果嗎？

SourceText: The seventh color is violet.
text: 第七種顏色是紫羅蘭色。

SourceText: Violet is a very intense color. Is it too intense for you, or do you enjoy how intense it is?
text: 紫羅蘭是一種非常強烈的顏色。對你來說，它是不是太強烈了，還是說你喜歡它的強烈程度？

SourceText: Now she has her arms crossed. Crossed arms can indicate being closed off from others.
text: 現在她雙臂交叉。交叉的手臂可以表示與其他人的隔絕。

SourceText: People tell us a lot without saying any words. Sometimes people do that with an expression on their face, and sometimes they do it with the way they hold their body.
text: 人們不用說話就能告訴我們很多。人們有時通過臉上的表情，有時通過他們的肢體語言進行傳達。

SourceText: My dress is violet. Violet is my favorite color! What is your favorite color?
text: 我的裙子是紫羅蘭色的。紫羅蘭是我最喜歡的顏色！你最喜歡的顏色是什麼？

SourceText: Notice that the flowers she is next to are violet flowers -- they are named after their color.
text: 注意她旁邊的花是紫羅蘭色的花——它們是根據它們的顏色命名的。

SourceText: She looks very happy wearing a dress with her favorite color. Do you have clothes that are in your favorite color?
text: 她穿著她最喜歡顏色的裙子看起來很開心。你有你最喜歡顏色的衣服嗎？

SourceText: Which colors make you happy? Are there colors you don't like?
text: 哪些顏色讓你開心？有沒有你不喜歡的顏色？

SourceText: Do you know the seven colors of the rainbow?
text: 你知道彩虹的七種顏色嗎？

SourceText: Can you remember what each color is?
text: 你能記住每種顏色是什麼嗎？

SourceText: Some people use the fake name Roy G. Biv to remind them of the order of the seven colors of the rainbow.
text: 有些人用顏色首字母組成的虛構的名字來記住彩虹的七種顏色的順序。

SourceText: Brown is not one of the main colors of the rainbow. Are there other colors you know that are not one of the seven?
text: 褐色不是彩虹的主要顏色之一。你知道其他不是七種顏色之一的顏色嗎？

SourceText: Fana and her family live in a busy town.
text: 法娜和她的家人住在一個​​繁忙的小鎮裡。

SourceText: Fana lives in a very colorful town. Is your town colorful too?
text: 法娜住在一個五顏六色的小鎮裡。你的小鎮也有很多顏色嗎？

SourceText: Point at and name all the colors of the clothes and buildings.
text: 指出衣服和建築物所有的顏色。

SourceText: Fana has a cat, two hens, a goat and a dove.
text: 法娜有一隻貓、兩隻母雞、一隻山羊和一隻鴿子。

SourceText: How many animals does Fana have?
text: 法娜總共有多少動物？

SourceText: Which animal does Fana have the most of?
text: 法娜有最多的是哪種動物？

SourceText: Most people living in a city do not have so many different animals.
text: 大多數住在城市裡的人沒有那麼多不同的動物。

SourceText: One day, Fana saw other children throwing stones at doves.
text: 有一天，法娜看到其他的孩子向鴿子扔石頭。

SourceText: Throwing stones at animals is a mean thing to do!
text: 有一天，法娜看到其他的孩子向鴿子扔石頭。

SourceText: What would you do if you saw someone doing something that was mean?
text: 向動物扔石頭是糟糕的行為！

SourceText: Count all the birds. Which is more and which is less -- birds in the air or birds on the ground?
text: 數一數所有的鳥。空中的鳥和地上的鳥哪個多，哪個少？

SourceText:
Fana ran towards the children.

She shouted, "Stop throwing stones!"
text:
法娜向孩子們跑去。

她喊道：「別再扔石頭了！」

SourceText: It is not easy to tell other people that you think they are being bad. Why did Fana do it?
text: 指出別人的壞行為並不容易。法娜為什麼這麼做？

SourceText: A rectangle is a shape with four straight sides like the shape of this page. Point out rectangles you see in this picture.
text: 長方形是有四條直邊的形狀，就像這頁紙的形狀一樣。指出你在這張圖片中看到的長方形。

SourceText: Do you see any rectangles around where you are?
text: 你在你的周圍看得到任何長方形嗎？

SourceText: Fana took the two doves home to look after them.
text: 法娜把兩隻鴿子帶回家照顧。

SourceText: It is very nice of Fana to help these animals. It can be dangerous to handle wild animals.
text: 幫助這些動物是好行為。處理野生動物可能很危險。

SourceText: Count the number of people and the number of birds. Which group is bigger and which group is smaller?
text: 數一數人和鳥的數量。哪一組更多，哪一組更少？

SourceText: What do their faces tell you about what they are feeling?
text: 它們的表情告訴你它們的感受是什麼？

SourceText: She fed them and told her family how she saved them.
text: 她餵了它們，並告訴了家人她是如何拯救它們的。

SourceText: How many children and how many adults are there in Fana's family? When you put those groups together, how many people are there in her family?
text: 法娜家裡有幾個孩子，有幾個大人？當你把這些群體放在一起時，她家裡一共有多少人？

SourceText: There are many colors of the rainbow here. Which colors are present and which ones are missing?
text: 這裡的彩虹有很多種顏色。哪些顏色在，哪些顏色不在？

SourceText: Which colors and patterns are your favorite to wear?
text: 你最喜歡穿什麼顏色和圖案的衣服？

SourceText: Fana and her parents took the doves to the clinic.
text: 法娜和她的父母把鴿子帶到了診所。

SourceText: Most doctors either help people or they help animals. Which kind of doctor is at this clinic?
text: 大多數醫生要麼幫助人，要麼幫助動物。這家診所裡的是哪種醫生？

SourceText: Who is the shortest person in this picture? Who is the tallest?
text: 這張照片裡誰最矮？ 誰最高？

SourceText: The red cross on the cabinet shows that it has medical supplies in it.
text: 櫃子上的紅十字表明裡面有醫療用品。

SourceText: Fana tells her friends, "Animals are our friends. We protect them."
text: 法娜告訴她的朋友們：「動物是我們的朋友。我們要保護它們。」

SourceText: Should we only protect our friends, or should we protect everything we can?
text: 我們是只應該保護我們的朋友，還是應該保護能保護的一切？

SourceText: Look at all the color patterns in these clothes. Point out which ones are solid, striped, or have a checkered pattern.
text: 看看這些衣服上的所有顏色圖案。指出純色、條紋和方格的圖案。

SourceText: Fana has worn many different colors during this story. Can you remember them all?
text: 在這個故事中，法娜穿了許多不同顏色的衣服。你全部記得住嗎？

SourceText: A Very Tall Man
text: 一個很高的男人

SourceText: This story looks at counting to 5, descriptions, and comparisons. Practice describing words: too, very, short, tall, long, low, high, big, small; color names; and comparison words: shorter, taller, longer, lower, higher, bigger, smaller
text: 這個故事是關於數字5以下的描述和比較。練習的詞語： 太、非常、矮高、長、低、高、大，和小；顏色名稱；還有比較詞：更短、更高、更長、更低、更高、更大和更小。

SourceText: Akadeli's Lucky Day
text: 阿卡黛麗的幸運日

SourceText: This story has  counting to 12, colors, and shapes. Practice words: one, two, to twelve, estimate, take away, color names, shortest, tallest, similar, and different.
text: 這個故事包括了1到12的數字，顏色和形狀。練習的單詞：一、二、到十二；估計；減去；顏色的名字；最短的；最高的；相似的；不同的。

SourceText: Can We Count Our Cats?
text: 我們能數一數我們的貓嗎？

SourceText: This story looks at counting from 0 to 9, colors, and color patterns. Practice counting words, color words, words like: too many, biggest number, smallest number, one more, and one less.
text: 這個故事介紹了從0到9的計數、顏色和色彩圖案。練習數詞、顏色詞，還有詞語比如：太多、最大的數、最小的數、多一個和少一個。

SourceText: Cat and Dog and the Ball
text: 貓、狗和球

SourceText: This story has counting to 6, colors, and descriptions. Practice counting words, color names, and words: high, too, similar, different, smallest, biggest, short, tall, biggest, smallest, fewer, and more.
text: 這個故事包括了到6的計數、顏色以及描述。練習計數詞、顏色名稱和以下詞語：高、太、相似、不同、最小、最大、短、高、最大、最小、更少和更多。

SourceText: Cat and Dog and the Butterfly
text: 貓和狗和蝴蝶

SourceText: This story has speed descriptions, colors, and counting to 6. Practice counting words, color words, and these words: very, too, fast, slow, faster, slower, fastest, slowest, most, and least.
text: 這個故事有關於速度的描述，顏色和到6的計數。練習計數單詞、顏色單詞、以及這些單詞：非常、太、快、慢、更快、更慢、最快、最慢、最多和最少。

SourceText: Cat and Dog and the Egg
text: 貓和狗和蛋

SourceText: This story has counting to 5, comparing, colors, and shapes. Practice words: round, above, below, similar, round, kite, different, bigger, and longer.
text: 本故事包含5以內的數數，比較、顏色和形狀。練習單詞：圓形的、在上面、在下面、相似的、圓形的、風箏、不同的、更大的和更長的。

SourceText: Cat and Dog: Dog Is Cold
text: 貓和狗: 狗很冷

SourceText: This story talks about extremes of describing words, and counting to 6 with one more or one less. Words to practice are: too, cold, warm, hot, light, dark, day, night, clean, dirty, small, big, short, long, wet, dry, thin, thick, low, high, new, and old.
text: 這個故事講述了極端的描述詞語，以及用多一個或少一個的方式數到6。練習的詞有：太、冷、暖、熱、光、暗、日、夜、乾淨、骯髒、小、大、短、長、濕、乾、薄、厚、低、高、新、和舊。

SourceText: Clever Cat
text: 聰明的貓

SourceText: This story has geometry ideas and colors. Practice words: square, rectangle, circle, concentric, open, closed, least, little, small, big, and color names.
text: 這個故事包括幾何數學和顏色。練習單詞：正方形、長方形、圓圈、同心圓、開、關、最少、小、大和顏色的名稱。

SourceText: Colors of a Rainbow
text: 彩虹的顏色

SourceText: This story talks about the numbers to seven, the ordinals to seventh, and colors. Practice the words: one, two, three, to seven; the ordinals first, second, third, to seventh; and the many names of colors.
text: 這個故事講述了數字一到七，序數詞第一到第七，以及顏色的內容。練習以下單詞：一、二、三到七；序數詞第一、第二、第三到第七；以及各種顏色的名稱。

SourceText: Counting Animals
text: 數動物

SourceText: This story has counting to 9 and number and size comparisons. Practice words: one, two, to nine, big, small, most, least, one more, and one less.
text: 這是數到九的故事, 比較數字和大小。 練習的單詞有: 數字一到九、小、最多、最少、多一個和少一個。

SourceText: Creature with Two
text: 有兩個的生物

SourceText: This story has counting to seven and shapes. Practice words: small numbers, especially one and two; and comparing words such as more, equal, same, and less. Also, talk about squares, circles, solids, stripes, bigger, and smaller.
text: 這個故事涉及到數字和形狀，涉及的詞語有：小數字，尤其是一和二；以及比較的詞語，如更多，相等，相同和更少。還要談論正方形，圓形，立體，條紋，更大和更小。

SourceText: Drum
text: 鼓

SourceText: This story has patterns, sizes, and shapes. Practice words: size, big, little, medium, small, same, shape, and pattern.
text: 這個故事涉及到模式、大小和形狀。練習以下詞語：大小、大、少、中等、小、相同、形狀和模式。

SourceText: Fana Loves Animals
text: 法娜喜歡動物

SourceText: This story has quantities to ten, comparing, and colors. Practice words: counting to ten, most, more, less, bigger, smaller, shortest, tallest, color names, solid, striped, and checkerboard.
text: 這個故事包括一到十、比較和顏色。練習單詞: 一到十、最多、 更多、更少、更大、更小、最短、最高、顏色的名稱、 實心、條紋、棋盤圖案。

SourceText: Feelings
text: 感情

SourceText: This story has quantities up to ten. Practice words: how many, one more, most, and least.
text: 這個故事涉及到最高到十的數量。練習以下詞語：有多少，再加一個，最多和最少。

SourceText: Flower Blind
text: 看不見的花

SourceText: This story has quantities to 10, comparing quantities, and shapes. Practice words: how many, most, least, one more, how many more, difference, rectangle, square, circle, and round.
text: 這個故事涉及到十以內的數量，比較數量以及形狀。練習以下詞語：有多少、最多、最少、多一個、多出多少、差異、矩形、正方形、圓形和圓。

SourceText: Friends
text: 朋友

Practice words: numbers to ten, skip counting, counting by 2's, 3's, 4's, 5's, and 10's, odd numbers, more, difference, add, combination, total, stripes, spots, big, biggest, fast, fastest, strong, strongest, large largest, high, higher, pattern, and problem solving.
text: 這個故事涉及數數、比較和解決問題。練習字詞：1到10的數字，跳數，以2、3、4、5、10的倍數跳數，奇數，更多，差異，相加，組合，總數，條紋，斑點，大，最大，快，最快，強，最強，高，更高，規律，解決問題。

SourceText:
This is Cat.

This is Dog.
text:
這是貓。

這是狗。

SourceText: Count the animals together and describe their colors.
text: 一起數一數這些動物，並描述祂們的顏色。

SourceText: Which one has shorter ears? Which one has longer ears?
text: 哪一隻的耳朵比較短？哪一隻的耳朵比較長？

SourceText: Which one has short whiskers? Which one has long whiskers?
text: 哪一隻的鬍鬚短一點？哪一隻的鬍鬚比較長？

SourceText:
It is night. It is dark.

It is cold. It is very cold.
text:
現在是晚上。現在是黑暗。

晚上很冷，非常冷。

SourceText: Their house is round. Do you live in a round building?
text: 他們的房子是圓型的。你住在一個圓形建築裡嗎？

SourceText: Count the trees together.
text: 一起數一數這些樹。

SourceText: A full moon forms a complete circle. A moon that is a partial circle like this is called a crescent moon.
text: 滿月時形成一個完整的圓。像這樣半圓形的月亮被稱為新月。

SourceText: For Dog it is too cold.
text: 對這隻狗來說，祂實在太冷了。

SourceText: What shows you that Dog is cold?
text: 是什麼讓你知道狗很冷呢？

SourceText: A light blue color is often used to show something cold. Does seeing blue make you feel cold?
text: 淺藍色經常被用來表示寒冷的東西。看到藍色是否讓你感到寒冷？

SourceText: On cold nights, even outdoor animals can use help with the cold.
text: 在寒冷的夜晚，即使是戶外動物也可以藉由幫助來應對寒冷。

SourceText:
Cat gives Dog underwear.

One pair of underwear is dirty. One pair of underwear is clean.
text:
貓給了狗兩件襯衣。

有一件襯衣是骯髒的。有一件襯衣是乾淨的。

SourceText: Is this choice of underwear very helpful?
text: 這樣的襯衣選擇是否很有幫助？

SourceText: Is it silly that Cat offers underwear that is dirty?
text: 貓咪提供的襯衣很髒，這是不是很搞笑？

SourceText: Why isn't Cat cold?
text: 為什麼貓不覺得冷？

SourceText: Dog takes the clean underwear. But it is still too cold.
text: 狗選擇了乾淨的襯衣。但祂仍然覺得太冷。

SourceText: Count together how much clothing Dog has. Dog is cold and needs more.
text: 一起數數狗有多少衣服。狗狗很冷，祂需要更多的衣服。

SourceText: Remember a time when you were cold and how hard it was to get warm.
text: 想一想某個當你很冷的時候，要取暖是多麼困難的事情。

SourceText: Why are Dog's arms crossed in front?
text: 為什麼狗的雙臂交叉在胸前面？

SourceText: Cat gives Dog shirts. One shirt is big. One shirt is small.
text: 貓給狗的兩件襯衫。一件襯衫是大的。一件襯衫是小的。

SourceText: Is offering a shirt that is much too small helpful?
text: 提供一件太小的襯衫有幫助嗎 ？

SourceText: Is Cat trying to help, or is Cat just having some fun?
text: 貓咪是想幫忙呢，還是只是想找點樂子？

SourceText: Which of Cat's paws has more visible claws?
text: 貓的哪個爪子比較明顯易見？

SourceText: Dog takes the big shirt. But it is still too cold.
text: 狗拿走了大襯衫。但祂仍然太冷了。

SourceText: Count the pieces of clothing Dog has. Is it enough?
text: 數一數狗身上的衣服。足夠嗎？

SourceText: A square is a shape like a piece of paper with four equal sides. Compare the round moon with the square window.
text: 正方形就像一張紙一樣的形狀，有四個相等的邊。比較一下圓形的月亮和方形的窗戶。

SourceText: Have you ever seen a round window?
text: 你見過圓形的窗戶嗎？

SourceText:
Cat gives Dog pants.

One pair of pants is long. One pair of pants is short.
text:
貓給了狗兩條褲子

一條褲子是長的。一條褲子是短的。

SourceText: How many pieces of clothing does Cat offer each time?
text: 貓咪每次提供多少件衣服給狗狗？

SourceText: When you are cold, do you want to wear shorts?
text: 當你感到寒冷時，你想穿短褲嗎？

SourceText: What will happen with Dog's tail? Do these pants have a hole for Dog's tail?
text: 狗的尾巴會發生什麼？這條褲子有為狗的尾巴開的洞嗎？

SourceText: Dog takes the long pair of pants. But it is still too cold.
text: 狗拿走了那條長褲。但祂仍然太冷了。

SourceText: Each time, Dog gets one more piece of clothing. How many pieces does Dog have on now?
text: 每一次，狗都能多得到一件衣服。狗現在穿了多少件衣服？

SourceText: How many pieces will Dog need?
text: 狗需要多少件衣服？

SourceText: Do you think there is any way Dog will get warm?
text: 你認為狗有辦法暖起來嗎？

SourceText:
Cat gives Dog vests. One vest is wet, one vest is dry.

Dog takes the dry vest, but it is still too cold.
text:
貓給狗兩件背心。一件背心是濕的，一件背心是乾的。

狗穿上了乾的背心，但祂還是太冷了。

SourceText: Does having something wet on make you feel warmer or colder?
text: 穿著濕的衣服會讓你感覺更溫暖還是更冷？

SourceText: Dog had three pieces of clothing on. The vest is one more. How many does that make?
text: 現在狗身上有三件衣服。背心是額外加的一件。這樣算起來有多少件？

SourceText: With the vest, Dog has four pieces of clothing. Before he put the vest on, he had one less. How many was that?
text: 穿上背心以後，狗現在有四件衣服。在祂穿上背心之前，祂的衣服數量少了一件。現在剩下多少件？

Cat gives Dog jackets. One jacket is thick, one jacket is thin.

Dog takes the thick jacket, but it is still too cold.

SourceText: Thicker clothing helps you keep heat in and stay warmer.
text: 較厚的衣服可以幫助你保持熱量並保持溫暖。

SourceText: Does the color of the jacket look odd with Dog's other clothes?
text: 這件外套的顏色與狗的其他衣服搭配起來是否顯得很奇怪？

text: 狗的衣服現在比四件多了一件。現在祂有多少件衣服？

Dog takes the high hat, but it is still too cold.

貓給狗戴帽子。一頂是高帽子，一頂是低帽子。

狗拿了高帽子，但是祂還是很冷。

SourceText: One of These is Not Like the Others
text: 找不同遊戲

SourceText:
This activity has your child looking at four things and deciding which three share a property that the fourth one does not. The following is a quick list of examples together with explanations. Children often have a fresh way of looking at things and it is well worth listening to them to see if their reasoning is novel yet sound.

There are several ways to present these four items to your child. The easiest for you is to simply say the list. If the items are easy to draw, you can draw them. If the items are hard to draw, you may be able to find photos or drawings in ads or magazines that you can cut out and select from. You may be able to use a single photo with lots of content and point out four things in the photo.

For activities like this, once your child has practiced this for a while and has a solid idea of the activity, it is good to reverse your roles - your child will learn a lot by creating examples for you to solve. As before, their reasoning may be very different from yours, so listen carefully.
text:
本游戲的規則是讓您的孩子從四個物品中找出與其他三個最不相同的一個。以下是一些示例和對應的説明。孩子們通常會以嶄新的方式看待事物，這值得家長們用心去聆聽並判斷小孩的推理是否既新穎又合理。

將這四個物品告訴孩子的方法有很多種，其中最簡單的方法就是逐個讀出來。如果這些物品容易畫，那麽您可以把它們畫出來。如果這些物品難畫，那麽您可以在廣告或雜誌中找出相應的圖片並剪裁出來。除此之外,您也可以從一張包含大量內容的照片中指出照片中的其中四個物品。

儅您的孩子練習了一段時間后對游戲有了紮實的認識，您就可以與您的孩子進行角色交換。換句話而言就是，由您的孩子出題來讓您解決。這樣他們能從中學到更多東西。一如既往的，他們的推理可能與您的推理大不相同，因此請您仔細觀察 。

SourceText: Groups of Four
text: 一組四個

SourceText:
Here are a few examples to help you get started.

* rabbit, dog, butterfly, pillow - The first three are alive and the pillow is not.
* banana, cheese, hammer, carrot - The hammer is the only one you cannot eat.
* cheese, shoes, coat, shirt - The cheese is the only one you cannot wear.
* red triangle, red square with a hole, green square, red square with no hole - Any one of the first three can be the odd one. The red triangle is the only one that is not a square. The red square with a hole is the only one that is not solid. The green square is the only one that is not red.
* dog, cat, lion, goldfish - The lion is the only animal on the list that would make a bad pet. It is also quite a bit bigger than the other animals. Or, three of them have four legs and the fish lives in water.
* bench, table, couch, stool - The table is the only one that you don’t sit on. Or only the couch is soft.
* bark, honk, rainbow, click - The rainbow is the only one that is not a sound.
* socks, pants, toothbrush, hat - The toothbrush is the only one that you wouldn’t wear.
* chair, umbrella, sofa, stool - The umbrella is the only one you wouldn’t want to sit on.
* ants, pig, spiders, grasshoppers - The pig is the only one that is not a little bug.

You can also do this with pictures instead of words. Make a habit of cutting pictures out of ads, magazines, and whatever else comes your way so that you can play games with the pictures.
text:
以下是一些幫助您入門的示例:

* 兔子、狗、蝴蝶、枕頭－前三個是動物，而枕頭不是。
* 香蕉、奶酪、錘子、胡蘿蔔－錘子是其中唯一不能吃的東西。
* 奶酪、鞋子、外套、襯衫－除了奶酪，其他的都是衣物。
* 紅色三角形、帶孔的紅色正方形、綠色的正方形、無孔的紅色正方形－前三個中的任何一個都可以是與衆不同的那個：紅色三角形是唯一不是正方形的形狀。帶有孔的紅色正方形是唯一不牢固的正方形。綠色方塊是唯一一個非紅色的。
* 狗、貓、獅子、金魚－獅子是清單上唯一一個不能儅寵物的動物，而且它也比其他動物大很多。或者，其中三個各有四條腿並且生活在陸地上，然而魚沒有腿并且生活在水中。
* 玫瑰叢、橡樹、楓樹、松樹－除了玫瑰叢，其他的都是樹。
* 長凳、桌子、沙發、凳子－桌子是唯一一個不是用來坐的家具。或者，沙發比其他的柔軟。
* 樹皮、喇叭聲、彩虹、單擊－彩虹是唯一沒有聲音的。
* 襪子、褲子、牙刷、帽子－牙刷是唯一一個不是用來穿的東西。
* 椅子、雨傘、沙發、凳子－雨傘是唯一一個不是用來坐的物品。
* 螞蟻、豬、蜘蛛、草蜢－豬是唯一一隻不屬於昆蟲的動物。

您也可以使用圖片代替文字來進行這個游戲。您平時可以養成從廣告、雜誌或者其他地方剪裁圖片的習慣，以便您使用這些圖片來玩這項遊戲。

SourceText: Island Hopping – Counting
text: 跳島-計數

SourceText: These puzzles have numbered islands (circles) connected by bridges (lines) drawn on paper. The challenge is to find a path that connects the islands in order.
text: 這些題目中標有編號的島嶼（圓）由橋樑（線）連接。玩家需要解決的問題是要找到一條路徑按照順序連接起各個島嶼。

SourceText:
The easiest versions have all the numbers filled in and the numbers go from 1 to the number of islands. You can vary this activity by starting at some number other than 1 and by leaving out some of the numbers.

Puzzles with all the numbers are straightforward once your child is confident with counting. Those beginning puzzles are good counting practice and are also good for building up confidence in puzzle solving. The more challenging puzzles are the ones with numbers left out.

Ease your child into these harder puzzles by leaving out just a few numbers and slowly move to leaving out more.
text:
在最簡單的版本中，從1到7所有的數字都已經填好。您可以通過從1以外的其他數字開始並省略一些數字來對這個游戲稍作改變。 

一旦您的孩子對計數建立起了信心，那些填滿了數字的版本都會顯得很簡單。從這些簡單的題目開始練習是個好策略，因爲有助於建立解決遊戲的信心。相對而言，更具挑戰性的是那些省略了部分數字的題目。

一開始只需省略幾個數字，然後慢慢省略更多數字，這樣就可以讓您的孩子循序漸進地解決這些遊戲。

SourceText:
The first of these two puzzles has every other number left out. This makes it relatively easy to fill in the missing numbers. 1 must attach to 0 and 2, and there is only one place for that. 3 must attach to 2 and 4, and with 1 filled in there is only one remaining place for the 3. 5 must go in the remaining place between 4 and 6.

The second puzzle is a little bit harder. 3 must attach to 2 and 4, so there is only one place for it. 5 must attach to 4, so there is only one place for it now. 6 must attach to the 5. Finally, 0 must go in the remaining spot.
text:
這兩個遊戲中的相鄰的數字被省略掉了，這個填寫起來相對容易。 1必然與0和2相鄰，然而這樣的位置只有一個。 3旁邊是2和4，並且1填上後只有一個位置滿足填3的要求。5肯定是在4和6之間。

第二個题目相对来说要難一些。 3必須与2和4相邻，因此只有一個位置可选。 5必須紧挨着4，所以現在只有一個地方。 6必須靠著5。最後，剩下的位置一定是0。

SourceText: To make the puzzle harder still, we can remove the 1 and play with removing some of the bridges. Have fun with variations and let your child design some of them, too.
text: 為了使這道題变得更加困難，我們可以刪除1以及一些橋。您可以嘗試各種變化，也可以讓您的孩子参与到設計之中。

SourceText: Cutting Symmetric Shapes
text: 剪紙

SourceText: Create designs by folding a piece of paper and cutting the paper while it is folded. This is called Kirigami.
text: 通過對一張紙折疊並剪裁來進行設計，這就叫做剪紙藝術。

SourceText: One Fold
text: 对折

SourceText: Folding the paper once and cutting it creates a design with one side the mirror image of the other. Experiment with cutting out faces, lamps, or geometric shapes. The star and tree were produced with a single fold, which is shown on the left, and then the unfolded paper is shown on the right.
text: 將紙張對折一次，然後將其裁切，即可創建出新的圖案，並且其中一側與另一側鏡像對稱。嘗試切出臉孔、燈或幾何形狀。以下兩個例子是一顆星星和一棵樹，其中左邊是對折時，右邊是展開後的圖案。

SourceText: Two Folds
text: 兩次对折

SourceText: Folding the paper once, and then folding once more in the opposite direction, will produce figures with two lines of mirror images. This makes it easy to create designs such as flowers. The figure on the left is the paper folded twice and cut to leave the blue area, and the figure on the right shows the unfolded paper.
text: 對折紙張一次，然後在垂直方向再對折一次，展開後的將會是兩組鏡像對稱的圖形。通過這個方法您可以製作出花朵等形狀。以下的圖形中，左圖是折疊了兩次之後剪裁出的形狀，右圖是展開後紙張的形狀。

SourceText: Three Folds
text: 三折

SourceText: Experiment with various folds and cuts. This figure was created by taking a twice folded piece of paper and then folding it once more diagonally through the corner of the previous folds.
text: 您可以嘗試各種折叠和裁剪方式。下圖是通過先將紙張折疊兩次，然後再將其對角線折疊到先前折疊的一角而得到的。

SourceText: Snowflakes
text: 雪花

SourceText:
This is a sequence of folds for creating 6-point snowflakes. Though it takes a few steps, don’t be put off by them - with a little practice they become quick and easy. 

Start by taking a standard sheet of paper and folding at one of the corners so the sides marked A and B meet. Leave the fold in place and cut along the line marked C.

Take the triangle produced and fold it in half so that sides AB and C overlap.

Put a temporary fold in this triangle and use the fold to mark the middle of side ABC. Undo the temporary fold.

Make a fold over F. When you fold over F, you will be looking to have G placed so that G breaks the angle in half. 

Fold along G - do this fold underneath so that this new folded piece is underneath the other paper.

Although not strictly necessary, it is a good idea to slice off the top of this figure. Otherwise, you might be tempted to use the region above the red dotted line without realizing that there isn’t paper on all levels.

Lastly, fold this triangle in half. At last you are all set to do the cutting of your design!

Have fun experimenting with many different combinations of cuts and colors!
text:
這是六邊雪花的製作流程。雖然乍一看步驟不少，但請不要被嚇到。其實您只需稍加練習，就熟能生巧。

首先，取一張標準紙並在一個角上折疊，使標記為A和B的兩面相交。將摺痕留在原處，並沿標記C的線切割。

取產生的三角形並將其對折，以使AB和C邊重疊。

在此三角形中放置一個臨時摺痕，並使用該摺痕標記側面ABC的中間，然後恢復臨時折疊。

在折疊F線條時，您要同時調整G線條的位置，以便讓G線條可以將ABC和F所構成的角度平分。

沿G线条折疊时要往下方進行折疊，以使新折疊的纸在其他紙的下面。

儘管並非絕對必要，但最好沿着红色虚线剪掉頂部，因为顶部区域的纸参差不齐、分布不均。

最後，將這個三角形對折。您現在終於可以開始正式您的設計了！

盡情享受嘗試各種不同的裁切和顏色組合所帶來的樂趣！

SourceText: Nim With One and Two
text: 關於數字1和2的尼姆遊戲

SourceText: The Game Rules
text: 遊戲規則

SourceText:
A target number, say 10, is chosen. Let your child choose whether to go first or second. The total starts at 0. During a turn, a person chooses to add 1 or 2 to the current total. The first person to reach the target wins. 

This game can also be played with subtraction. In this version, the starting total starts at the target, which in this example is 10. On a given turn the player chooses whether to subtract 1 or 2. The first person to reach 0 wins.

Another variation is that instead of winning, the player forced to hit or go beyond the target number loses. You can also experiment with what happens if you allow a player to add (or subtract) 1, 2, or 3 for each turn.
text:
選擇一個目標數字（例如10）。讓您的孩子選擇是他先開始還是您先開始。從0開始，在每回合中，一個人選擇在當前數字上加1或2，第一個達到目標數字的人獲勝。

此遊戲也可以用減法來進行：從目標數字開始（例如10），在每回合中，玩家選擇減去1還是2。第一個達到0的人獲勝。

該遊戲的另一個玩法是：被迫達到目標數字或超過目標數字的玩家並非獲勝，而是輸了。您還可以嘗試看看如果允許玩家每回合增加（或減去）1、2或3會發生什麼情況。

SourceText: Understanding the Game
text: 了解遊戲

SourceText:
Without analyzing anything, this game is enjoyable to play and it provides good practice with adding or subtracting 1 and 2. We could leave it at that. However, it is also a great example of two problem solving techniques that you can show to your child when they are ready: 1) learning from simpler examples, and 2) looking for patterns.

Any of the versions can be studied this way. Let’s look at one: Subtracting starting at 10 and whoever gets 0 wins. The hard part of this game is that 10 is so far from 0. So, let’s look at a simpler version. When children are asked to do this, they often suggest starting at 5 or 6 - it seems absurd to them to start at 1, but that is actually what they should do! Often it is best to start as simply as possible - that means starting at 1. If it is your move and the count is 1, you win. Do the next few. If the count is 2, you win. If the count is 3, you must lose - whether you subtract 1 or 2, you will give your opponent a winning position. If the count is 4, you will win because you will subtract 1 and put your opponent in a losing position. Continuing in this way, build up a table of results:

1W - 2W - 3L - 4W - 5W - 6L - 7W - 8W - 9L - 10W
text:
這款遊戲無需進行任何分析，它本身就很有趣，而且您的孩子可以通過該遊戲來練習1和2的加減法。除此之外，当您的孩子准备好时您可以通过这个例子展示兩個解決問題的好技巧：1）從更簡單的示例中學習， 2）尋找规律。

该游戏的任何版本都可以通過這種方式進行学习。讓我們看一個例子：從10開始做减法，得到0的人获得勝利。這個遊戲的難點是10離0太遠了。所以，讓我們看一個更簡單的版本。當要求孩子這樣做時，他們通常建議從5或6開始（從1開始似乎是荒謬的，但這實際上是他們應該做的！）通常最好是盡可能從簡單的開始（這意味著從1開始）。如果這是您先走並且計數為1，那麽通過減1您就可以獲勝。再試試別的數字。如果計數為2，您可以通過減2獲勝。如果計數為3，那麼您必輸無疑，無論是減去1還是2，您都將對手置於必勝之地。如果計數為4，您將獲勝。因為您將減去1，並將對手置於必敗之地。以此類推，我們可以建立如下表格：

1赢 - 2赢 - 3输 - 4赢 - 5赢 - 6输 - 7赢 - 8赢 - 9输 - 10赢

SourceText:
This table makes it obvious that there is a repeating pattern of 3. When starting at 10, you should want to go first and subtract 1. What is satisfying about this is that, once you decide to look at simpler versions of the problem, the analysis is quick and easy - no tricky analysis needed. Now you are a Master at this game and you know what to do starting at any number! Any version of this basic game is just as easy to analyze.

But wait, there is one last question. Why is there a repeating pattern of 3? Once one player is stuck on a losing number which is a multiple of three, every pair of moves after that can be made to add up to 3 - if the losing player subtracts 1 the other player subtracts 2, and if the losing player subtracts 2 the other player subtracts 1.
text:
從該表可以看出規律：每三個連續的數字對應的結果都是相同的。所以每當從10開始，您就應該先減去1。讓人感到欣慰的是，無論問題多復雜，一旦您從問題的簡單版本著手，您就可以輕松快捷地尋找到規律而無需進行復雜的分析。現在您已成為尼姆遊戲大師了，從任何數量開始該您都知道該怎麼做！這個基本遊戲的任何版本都同樣容易分析。

那麽現在問題來了：為什麼重復的輸贏規律是數以3計？一旦一個玩家被困在了“輸”的數字（即是3的倍數）上，那麽此後的每一回合兩個玩家所減數字之和都可以是3。因為如果占下風的玩家減去1，則占上風的玩家可以減去2；如果占下風的玩家減去2，那麽占上風的玩家可以減去1。這樣一來占下風的玩家會一直被困在“輸”的數字上。

SourceText: Connect The Dots
text: 點點相連

SourceText: Making Everyday Scenes With Dots
text: 用點描繪日常用品

SourceText: Complete fun drawings by connecting numbered dots. One way is to take a simple drawing, say of a house, remove some straight lines and replace them with numbered dots, that when connected in order recreate the original drawing.
text: 通過連接帶有編號的點來進行有趣的繪圖。一種方法是先畫一個簡單的圖，例如一個房子，然後擦除掉其中一些直線，並用帶編號的點來代替它們。如果將這些點按順序連接起來就可以重現原圖。

SourceText: Making Geometric Patterns With Angles
text: 製作帶有角度的幾何圖案

SourceText: Make abstract drawings by connecting points with the same number along opposite sides of an angle. The numbers may not be needed - if so, feel free to omit them - this will make the finished designs a little less cluttered. You can add variety to these by having your child draw with colors. There are lots of amazing examples of this to be found under the category of String Art on the Internet. This circle drawing was made by moving ahead by one dot on one side of the line segment and ahead by two dots on the other side.
text: 在一個角的兩側分布著對應兩組相同編號的點，通過連接兩兩相同編號的點就可以製作抽象的集合圖形。您也許在作畫的過程中根本不需要用到這些編號，如果是這樣的話您可以將數字省略掉-這樣就可以讓設計看起來更加整潔。您可以通過讓孩子用彩色繪畫來讓圖案看起來更加豐富多彩。從網絡上您可以在紗線畫的類別中找到很多相關的例子。最右邊這個圓形圖案是通過在線段的一端連接一個點並在另一端連接兩個點來實現的。

SourceText: Making Patterns With Circles
text: 用圓圈製作圖案

SourceText:
This is a special case of the last idea. Put some dots, say 8 or 9, evenly spaced on a circle. Your child can play with creating different patterns by connecting the dots in order, or connecting every second dot, or every third dot. To make it easier to do different experiments, use push pins in a piece of cardboard or wood and then use string between the push pins.

If your child is intrigued by the patterns that are produced, you can look at questions such as: For a circle with 8 dots, why is only one string needed to skip by 1, 3, 5, or 7, but 2 or 4 strings are needed for skipping 2, 4, or 6. Similarly, for a circle with 9 dots, why is only one string needed to skip by 1, 2, 4, 5, 7, or 8, but 3 strings are needed for 3 and 6? It’s too young to understand the idea that 2, 4, and 6 have a factor in common with 8, and 3 and 6 have a factor in common in 9 - however, seeing the patterns may plant the seeds for later ideas.
text:
這是上面提到的最後一個方案的特例。將一定數量的點（比如說8或者9個）均勻地分佈在一個圓上，然後讓您的孩子按數字的順序連接各個點，或者每隔一個或者兩個點來連接。如果想讓這個遊戲進行地更加容易，您可以在一塊紙板或木頭上釘上圖釘來代表各個點，然後用細線在圖釘之間編織圖案。

如果您的孩子對他製作的圖案感興趣，不妨進一步去思考一下這些問題：對於一個有8個點的圓，為什麼通過每跳1、3、5或7步的連接方法只需要用到一條線就可以把所有點連接滿，然而如果是，每跳2、4或者6步則需要用到2條甚至6條線。類似地，對於一個有9個點的圓，為什麼每跳1，2、4、5、7或8步連接只需要用到1條線，而對於3或者6步連接則需要用到3條。雖然對於小孩子來說它們還太小，大概難以理解2、4、6與8有共同的因數，而3、6和9有共同的因數——但是，這個遊戲能給他們日後的思維方式埋下啟蒙的種子。

SourceText: Shape Sudoku
text: 拼圖數獨

SourceText:
This is your child’s first math puzzle, and that’s pretty cool! It also means you should take it very slowly so your child has lots of success and fun, and very little frustration.

The rules for these 4 by 4 Sudokus are very simple. There are four different types of tokens. There should be one of each kind of token in each row, column, and 2 by 2 corner of the puzzle. Use moveable pieces so that it is easy for your child to experiment in finding solutions.

The first puzzles you make should just have one token missing from each row. Once your child understands and figures out those puzzles, you can move to trickier ones, but do not be in a hurry.

The easiest way to create these puzzles is to start with a finished Sudoku and remove some of the tokens. To help you to do that, there are a number of finished Sudokus supplied below. After those finished examples, there is a list of methods you can use to create puzzles from a finished puzzle.
text:
這是您孩子的第一個數學遊戲，這很酷！這也意味著您應該非常緩慢地進行練習，以使您的孩子獲得很多成功和樂趣，並且很少感到沮喪。

這些4x4拼圖數獨的規則非常簡單。每個拼圖中有四種不同類型的符號。每種符號都應該出現在拼圖的每行、每列以及每個2 x 2角中。建議使用可移動的卡片來製作拼圖，因爲這樣能讓您的孩子輕鬆地嘗試尋找解決方案。

您製作的第一個拼圖應該在每一行中都缺少一種符號。一旦您的孩子理解並弄清楚了這些遊戲，您就可以嘗試更具挑戰性的遊戲，但請循序漸進。

創建這些遊戲最簡單的方法是從完整的數獨開始，然後刪除一些符號。為了幫助您做到這一點，下面提供了許多完整的數獨。接下來，我們提供了一系列方法指導您如何從完整的數獨中創建您自己的新數獨。

SourceText: Finished Sudokus
text: 完整的數獨

SourceText:
Before giving you a collection of finished Sudokus, there is one thing to note. You can take any one of these and create 23 more of them simply by interchanging token types - for example, you can take a finished puzzle and create a “new” one by swapping the circles and triangles and swapping the diamonds and squares. 

The examples below are distinctly different from each other and cannot be made from each other by doing interchanges. You can create more examples from these by doing such interchanges if you like.
text:
在給您完整的數獨例子之前，值得註意的一點是：您可以通過交換任意一種圖案類型來創建額外23個不同數獨。例如，您可以通過替換圓形和三角形或者替換菱形和正方形來創建一個新的數獨。

下面的示例彼此之間各不相同，並且不能通過圖案替換來得到另外一個。因此您可以通過上述的交換方法從示例中創建更多數獨。

SourceText: Methods for Creating Sudokus From Solved Ones
text: 利用完整的數獨創建新數獨的方法

SourceText:
Once you have a finished Sudoku, you can use any of the following strategies to create a puzzle that has a unique solution. Generally speaking, the more tokens you remove, the harder the puzzle will be.

* Remove a single token from each row or from each column.
* Remove a single token from each 2 by 2 corner.
* Remove all of one kind of token from the entire puzzle.
* Remove all tokens from one 2 by 2 corner.
* Remove one entire row and one entire column.
* Remove all of one kind of token and one each of the other kinds of tokens.
* Remove all tokens from two 2 by 2 opposite corners.
* Remove all tokens from two 2 by 2 opposite corners and 1 token each from the other two corners.

Of course, these are not the only methods you can use. They are just supplied here as sure-fire general methods that will quickly create puzzles.
text:
在完成數獨遊戲後，您可以使用以下任何方法來創建具有獨特解決方案的新數獨。一般來說，刪除的圖案越多，難度就越大。

* 從每一行或每一列中刪除一個圖案。
* 從每個2 x 2角刪除一個圖案。
* 從整個拼圖中刪除所有一種圖案。
* 從1個2 x 2角移除所有圖案。
* 刪除一整行和一整列。
* 刪除所有一種圖案，以及其他每種圖案。
* 從兩個2 x 2相對的角上移走所有圖案。
* 從兩個2 x 2個相對的角中刪除所有圖案，並從其他兩個角中的每個令牌中刪除1個圖案。

當然，以上并不是全部方法，我們只是將一些常規的方法列出來以供您參考，以幫助您快速創建數獨。您完全可以自己嘗試運用一些其他的方法來創建新的數獨。

SourceText: Number Sudoku With Jigsaws
text: 帶有拼圖的數字數獨

SourceText:
This is similar to the Shape Sudoku puzzles, only now it uses numbers. If your child is not ready to recognize numerals yet, you can use quantities of dots instead. To avoid erasing, use numbered (or dotted) slips of paper to solve the puzzles.

For a 4 by 4 puzzle, each row and column has the numbers from 1 to 4 once. Also, each marked subregion has the numbers from 1 to 4 once.

Create these puzzles for your child by starting with a completed puzzle with moveable pieces of numbered paper and then removing some of the pieces of paper.
text:
數字數獨類似於圖形數獨，唯一不同的是數字代替了圖形。如果您的孩子尚未準備好識別數字，您則可以改用不同數量的點來代替數字。為避免塗改，建議您使用帶有編號（或虛線）的紙條來輔助解題。

對於4 x 4拼圖，每個行和列的編號從1到4一次。同樣，每個標記的子區域都有1到4的數字。 

首先從一個完整的拼圖開始，使用可移動的帶編號的紙，然後移走一些紙，為您的孩子創建這些拼圖。

SourceText: 4 by 4 Puzzles
text: 4 x 4 拼圖

SourceText: The 4 by 4 puzzles with subregions that are the 2 by 2 corners are exactly the same as the Shape Sudoku puzzles given before. You can go back to that page in these Resources to see solved versions of those puzzles. To create a numbered version of them, replace each colored shape by a number. For example, red circles could be 1, orange triangles 2, purple diamonds 3, and blue squares 4.
text: 由2 x 2子區域組成的4 x 4拼圖與之前給出的圖形數獨完全相同。您可以翻回之前的頁面去查看這些題目的解決方案。要將圖形數獨轉換數字數獨版本，只需要用不同數字來替換不同彩色形狀。例如，紅色1代表圓圈、2代表橙色三角形、3代表紫色菱形、4代表藍色正方形。

SourceText: 5 by 5 Puzzles
text: 5 x 5 拼圖

SourceText:
There are too many of these puzzles to come anywhere close to showing all the possible jigsaw geometries. These are here just to suggest what is possible. Your child may enjoy finding different ways of carving up a 5 by 5 square into pieces that have 5 small squares. 

Pieces that consist of 5 little squares are called “pentominoes.” Making shapes with pentominoes can be lots of fun. Maybe cut out some pentomino shapes out of stiff thick colored paper and see what designs you can make!
text:
由於這種類型的題目太多了，我們無法窮舉出所有可能性的組合。舉出這些例子的目的是想讓您了解其中的規律。您的孩子可能會喜歡嘗試用不同的方法來將5 x 5的正方形切成5片各含有5個小正方形的子區域。 

由5個小方塊組成的區域稱為“五格拼版”，使用它們來製作拼圖會很有趣。也許您可以從一張厚的彩色紙上切出一些五格拼版，然後看看可以做些什麼設計！

SourceText: 6 by 6 Puzzles
text: 6 x 6 拼圖

SourceText: Okay, you are getting the idea. There are a lot of these! Here are just a few 6 by 6 puzzles to give you some ideas for what is possible. As always, play around with your child with these puzzle pieces and numbers. Perhaps design a few of these together.
text: 好了，您現在已經對這個遊戲有初步的了解了。實際上還有很多類似的拼圖！這裡我們展示了幾個6 x 6的拼圖，可以為您提供一些想法。像之前一樣，與您的孩子參與其中，並且嘗試一起設計一些自己的遊戲。

SourceText: Greater Than Sudoku
text: 大於號數獨

SourceText:
Greater Than Sudoku puzzles start with the same rules as regular Sudoku - each number appears exactly once in each row, column, and subregion. Additionally, if there is a less than or greater than symbol between two cells, then the numbers in the cells must obey that relationship. 

Make these puzzles by using a finished Sudoku puzzle - all the example Number Sudoku Jigsaw puzzles given early in these Resources will be useful in creating these puzzles. Put in greater than and less than signs on a blank grid of the same geometry. If you omit all the numbers and put in all the inequalities (less than or greater than), it is generally fairly easy to solve the puzzle. A useful strategy for your child is to first look for where the smallest and largest numbers should go.
text:
大於号數獨謎題的基本规则与常規數獨大致相同——每個數字在每一行、每一列以及每個子區域中只能出現一次。此外，如果單元格中的數字必須符合数值之间的小於或大於号所规定的条件。

您可以基于之前所完成的常规數獨来製作這些大于号数独——本教材中前面提供的所有示例數獨都会對創建這些新的謎題很有帮助。在相同幾何形狀的空白網格上插入大於和小於符號。如果省略所有數字並輸入所有不等式（小於或大於），通常很容易解決遊戲。對於您的孩子來說，一個有用的策略是首先尋找最小和最大數字應該放在什么地方。

SourceText: When your child is first learning how to do these puzzles, put in all the inequalities and some of the numbers. Gradually, start omitting more of the numbers and some of the inequalities.
text: 當您的孩子第一次學習如何解決這些遊戲時，請先填入所有不等号和部分數字。逐漸地，開始省略更多的數字和一些不等号。

SourceText: Make Me a Liar
text: 拆慌游戏

SourceText: Someone makes an absolute statement and the other players attempt to show that the person is lying. This is done by finding an example that breaks the statement.
text: 某人先進行一段陳述，而其他玩家則負責證明此人在撒謊，比如通過找到舉反例來拆穿謊言。

SourceText: Simple Statements That Are Almost Always True
text: 幾乎總是正確的簡單陳述

SourceText:
One type of statement to use is saying that something is always true. Here are some examples with quick discussions of why they are lies.

* All trucks have four wheels. - Large trucks often have 6, 10 or more wheels.
* All rectangles are squares. - Rectangles need not have all their sides the same length.
* All birds can fly. - Ostriches, emus, and kiwis are birds that cannot fly.
* The moon is only visible at night. - The moon is often visible during the day.
* All shapes have straight sides. - A circle does not have a straight side.
* All playgrounds have swing sets. - Some playgrounds don’t have swing sets.
* All rooms have chairs. Bedrooms and bathrooms often don’t have a chair.
text:
一種說法是說某些事情總是正確的。以下是此類型說法的一些例子，後面包含了簡要說明為什麼它們是謊言。

* 所有卡車都有四個輪子。——大型卡車通常有6个、10个，甚至更多的車輪。
* 所有矩形都是正方形。 ——矩形的邊長不必相同。
* 所有的鳥都能飛。 ——鴕鳥、鴯鶓和鷸鴕是不會飛的鳥。
* 月亮僅在晚上可見。 ——在白天經常可見月亮。
* 所有形狀均具有直邊。 ——圓沒有直邊。
* 所有遊樂場都有鞦韆。 ——有些遊樂場沒有鞦韆。
* 所有房間都有椅子。——臥室和浴室通常沒有椅子。

SourceText: If-Then Statements That Are Almost Always True
text: 幾乎總是正確的“如果......那麼......”陳述

SourceText:
Another type of statement is of the form “if __, then ___ .” Here are some examples with quick discussions of why they are lies.

* If today is Monday, then it is a school day. - Some Mondays are holidays and some Mondays occur during the summer.
* If I don’t eat for three hours, then I am hungry. - Most people can sleep for more than three hours and not wake up hungry.
* If a person is taller than someone, then they are older. - Children often grow up to be taller than their parents.
* If the sun is shining, it is a warm day. - Winter days can be sunny and cold.
* If someone is late, something bad must have happened to them. - Sometimes people are late through carelessness or reasons beyond their control (traffic, bad weather, car trouble).
text:
另一種聲明形式為「如果__，則___」。以下是一些示例，其中簡要討論了它們為什麼是謊言。

* 如果今天是星期一，那今天就要上學。——有些星期一是假期，有些星期一在暑假。
* 如果我三個小時不吃飯，那我就餓了。 ——大多數人可以睡三個小時以上，並且不會餓著肚子。
* 如果一個人比某人高，那麽高的人比矮的人老。 ——孩子長大後通常會比父母高。
* 如果陽光明媚，那就是溫暖的一天。 ——冬季可能天晴又寒冷。
* 如果某人遲到了，那一定是發生了一些壞事。 ——有時人們會由於粗心或無法控製的原因（交通，惡劣的天氣，汽車故障）而遲到。

SourceText: 15-Sliding Puzzle
text: 15格拼圖

SourceText: Puzzle Description
text: 拼圖說明

SourceText:
The classic version of this puzzle starts with a 4 x 4 empty grid of squares formed by 5 horizontal and vertical lines. Use a set of 15 pieces of paper the size of the grid squares, and number the pieces of paper from 1 to 15. The puzzle starts by having someone place the pieces of paper on the grid. The object of the puzzle is to get the pieces of paper in order with only the lower right hand corner of the grid empty. To achieve this, a piece of paper can be moved if it is adjacent to the empty square - in which case it can be slid into that space. Depending on how the person sets up the puzzle, the puzzle may or may not be solvable.

A 4 x 4 grid is too hard for a beginner, so start with something smaller. The grid could be as small as 2 x 2 or as big as the child wants. The number of numbered pieces of paper will always be one less than the size of the grid. For example, on a 2 x 3 grid use the cards from 1 to 5.
text:
這個游戏的經典版本以由5條水平和垂直線形成的4 x 4的正方形空網格開始。使用一組15張紙，其大小為網格正方形，並從1到15對紙進行編號。這個游戏的開始是有人將紙放在網格上。游戏的目的是在僅使網格的右下角為空的情況下使紙張有序。為此，如果一張紙與空的正方形相鄰，則可以將其移動-在這種情況下，可以將其滑入該空間。取決於人如何設置拼圖，拼圖可能可以解決，也可能無法解決。

4 x 4的網格對於初學者來說太難了，因此從較小的網格開始。網格可以小到2 x 2，也可以大到孩子想要的大小。編號的紙張數總是比網格的尺寸少一。例如，在2 x 3的網格上，使用從1到5的卡片。

SourceText: To create these puzzles, you have two options. The first is to place the squares randomly, in which case you have a 50 / 50 chance of the position being solvable. Alternatively, you can start by placing the pieces of paper in the final position and then making a series of legal moves to move the paper around. When you are all done, you are guaranteed that the puzzle is solvable.
text: 要设计這些拼圖，您有兩個選擇。第一種是將正方形隨機放置，在這種情況下，这个拼图有50%的几率是可解決的。另一种方法是，您可以先將紙張放置在最終完成的位置，然後随机按照游戏规则移动紙張。这样就可以保證拼圖是可解決的。

SourceText: Solving the Puzzle
text: 進行遊戲

SourceText:
The main reason for a child to play with this puzzle is to have fun moving pieces around until they accidentally solve it and also to practice getting numbers in order. Despite that simple goal, you may start to wonder about deeper ideas in the puzzle.

A frequent theme of problem solving is to learn from simpler problems or examples. So, let’s do that.

The smallest example is 2 by 2. For this size, it is clear that the rows will end up being either 1 2; 3 0 or 1 3; 2 0.

The next smallest is 2 by 3. Start this by getting the 1 and 4 in the left column. Once this is done, your puzzle will look like 1 _ _; 4 _ _ . Finish off the last four squares as you would the 2 by 2 case.

The 2 by 4 puzzle is done similarly. Start by putting 1 and 5 in the left column. Next, put the 2 and 6 in the second left column without disturbing the 1 and 4. Finally finish off the last 2 by 2.

At this point, the pattern for attacking puzzles with 2 rows is clear. What to do with more than 2 rows? Suppose you have 3 rows. Start the solution by getting the top row correctly laid out. After that, leave the top row undisturbed and use your ability to solve a puzzle with 2 rows.

Similarly, if there are 4 rows, do the top row first, the second row next (without disturbing the top row), and finish off the last 2 rows as before.
text:
讓孩子玩這個遊戲的一個主要原因是讓他們樂在其中，直到他們不小心解決了問題，並且還可以從中練習按順序排列數字。儘管目標很簡單，但您可能會開始好奇這個的更深層的用意。

解決問題的常見方法是從簡單的問題或示例中學習。所以，讓我們開始吧。

最小的示例是2 x2。對於這種大小，很明顯，行最終要麽是1 2; 3 0，或者是1 3; 2 0

第二小的是2x3。對於這個尺寸，可以先把1和4移到最左側一列中。完成此操作後，您的拼圖將看起來像1 _ _； 4 _ _。完成最後的四個正方形，就像處理2 x 2的情況一樣。

2 x 4拼圖的處理方法與此類似。首先把1和5移到最左側一列中。接下來，將2和6放在左側第二列，而先不要管1和4。最後解決2 x2。

目前為止我們已經清楚了如何解決2行拼圖，那麽超過2行的應該怎麼辦？比如說對於3行的拼圖，您可以通過從正確排列第一行著手。之後，維持第一行現狀，接下來的就和解決兩行拼圖一樣了。

同樣，如果有4行，則先進行第一行，然後進行第二行（不影響第一行），然後再像以前一樣完成最後兩行。

SourceText: Is This Puzzle Solvable?
text: 這個拼圖可以解決嗎？

SourceText:
Okay, you have a simple method for solving the puzzle. The next question is: How can I just look at the puzzle and know whether it is solvable or not?

To make describing the answer as simple as possible, do a few quick moves, if needed, to place the empty square in the bottom row. Next, make a list of the rows in one long list - the first row is listed first, the second row is listed second, and so on with the last row listed last. Omit the empty square when you list the last row.

Take this long list and count the number of inversions in it. When a number earlier in the list is larger than a number later in the list, this is called an inversion. If the number of inversions is an even number, then the puzzle is solvable. If it is an odd number, it is not.

As an example, take the 3 by 3 puzzle at the start of this discussion. Start by moving the 4 up to the second row. Then the list is: 6 1 2 4 8 5 3 7. There are 10 inversions in this list: 6 1, 6 2, 6 4, 6 5, 6 3, 4 3, 8 5, 8 3, 8 7, and 5 3. There are an even number of inversions, so the puzzle is solvable.

Why does this rule work? I won’t drag you through a detailed analysis. The key idea is to keep track of the number of inversions every time you make a move. It turns out that, if you adjust for the hole being in the last row, the number of inversions must always change by an even number after any move. Consequently, if the number of inversions starts as an odd number, it can never get down to 0 inversions.
text:
很好，您現在已經掌握了一種簡單的方法來解決拼圖。那麽下一個問題來了：我怎樣才能看一下拼圖就知道它是否可以解決呢？

為了使答案的描述盡可能簡單，如有必要，請快速執行一些操作，以將空白正方形放在底行中。接下來，在長列表中列出行的列表——第一行列在第一位，第二行列在第二行，依此類推，最後一行列在最後。當您列出最後一行時，請忽略空的正方形。

拿這個長長的清單，計算其中的反轉次數。當列表中較早的數字大於列表中較晚的數字時，這稱為取反。如果求反數是偶數，那麼這個遊戲就可以解決。如果是奇數，則不是。

以本討論開始時的3 x 3拼圖為例。首先將4移至第二行。然後，列表為：6 1 2 4 8 5 3 7。此列表中有10對數字是順序顛倒的：6 1, 6 2, 6 4, 6 5, 6 3, 4 3, 8 5, 8 3, 8 7, 和5 3。因為顛倒數字的對數是偶數，所以這個遊戲是可以解決的。

為什麼該規則有效？我不會在這裏進行詳細的推論。關鍵思想是每次移動時都要留意顛倒數字的對數。事實證明，如果您把空格放到最後一行中，那麼在進行任何一步移動之後，顛倒數字的對數始終以偶數變化。因此，如果顛倒數字的對數是奇數，那麽這個拼圖永遠不可能按順序排列。

SourceText: Investigations
text: 調查

SourceText: Bigger Boards
text: 更大的遊戲板

SourceText: One Working Number
text: 單鍵操作模式

SourceText: Two Working Numbers
text: 雙鍵操作模式

SourceText: Binary Numbers
text: 二進制數字遊戲

SourceText:
It is a hot, sunny Saturday morning on the farm. Maya, Duksie, and Doobie are helping Mama K in her vegetable garden. The children work all morning. They dig compost into the soil. They weed and water the garden. Then, the harvest is ripe.

Today each of the children will take home freshly picked strawberries, spinach, and carrots.
text:
星期六上午，在一個明媚炎熱的農場裡，瑪雅、達喜和多彼正在幫助柯媽媽在她的菜園裡幹活。孩子們忙了一整個上午。他們往土壤裡堆肥，除雜草並給植物澆水。然後，他們收割了成熟的水果和菜。

每個孩子今天都會帶一些新鮮採摘的草莓、菠菜和胡蘿蔔回家。

SourceText: Have you ever worked in a garden or farm? Freshly grown food has wonderfully strong flavors!
text: 你是否在花園或農場裡工作過？新鮮種植的蔬菜水果都有濃郁清香味的！

SourceText: Rectangles are four-sided shapes like the shape of this page. Can you find all the rectangles on this page? There are a lot of them!
text: 矩形是四邊形狀，就像這一頁的形狀一樣。這頁裡有很多矩形的東西，你能找到這頁上的所有 的矩形嗎？

SourceText: If you look closely, you'll notice that some of the rectangles are squares, with all their sides the same length. Can you find them?
text: 如果你仔細觀察，你會注意到有一些矩形也是正方形，正方形的四條邊都是相同長度的。你能找到它們嗎？

SourceText:
Mama K always gives the children a treat for helping her. Sometimes the treat is cake, chocolate, or long sweets that look like snakes. Sometimes it's apples, pears, or oranges.

Mama K has only one rule. "Share it fair!" The children know they must share the treats equally, so they all get the same amount.
text:
柯媽媽一般都會給孩子們準備一些好吃的東西作為幫助她的獎勵。有時她會準備蛋糕、巧克力或看起來很像蛇的糖果。有時她會準備的是蘋果、梨或橙子。 

無論她準備的是什麼，她分配只有一個規則。「公平分配」 孩子們都知道他們必須一起公平分配收到的獎勵，他們都會確保每個人都能得到相同的數量。

SourceText: Think about what it means to share something equally. Suppose you had 12 cookies to share evenly among 3 people. How many cookies would each person get?
text: 想想平等分配的邏輯。假設你有12塊餅乾要平分給3個人。每個人會得到多少塊餅乾？

SourceText: What would you do if you had 4 or 5 pieces of hard candy to share among 3 people?
text: 如果你有4或5塊硬糖要分給3個人，你會怎麼做？

SourceText: What if the things are different? How would you share an apple, an orange, and a banana among three people? Sharing can be tricky, even when everyone is trying to be fair.
text: 如果有幾樣不同的東西該怎麼辦？比如你會如何把一個蘋果、一個橙子和一個香蕉平均分配給3個人？雖然每個人都想平等分配，但是有時候平等的分配會變得棘手。

SourceText: Today Mama K has baked a round strawberry cake with pink icing and berries from her garden. The children wait on the grass for their treat. "Here you go!" smiles Mama K. "But remember the rule that everyone must get the same. Share it fair! Don't fight!"
text: 今天，柯媽媽烤了一個粉紅色糖蛋奶油圓形草莓蛋糕，蛋糕上的草莓來自她自己的菜園。孩子們都坐在草地上等待他們的糕點。「給你們！」 柯媽媽微笑著說。「但要記住規則，每個人都必須得到同等大小的蛋糕。要公平的分配！千萬不要打架！」

SourceText: Fortunately, cake is easy to share. How would you share this cake among the three children?
text: 幸運的是，蛋糕很容易分配。你會如何把蛋糕分給三個孩子分享呢？

SourceText: When someone dies, it is sometimes very hard to find an equal way to share all the different things that person owned.
text: 當人去世後，有時很難找到一種公平的方式分配這些財產，因為很多類別都是不同的。

SourceText: Can you think of a time when you and your friends or your family had something to share and it was tricky to find a way to do it? How was the problem solved?
text: 你和朋友或家人分配東西的時候，是否有找不到解決方法的情況嗎？這個問題最後是如何解決的？

SourceText:
Maya has the first turn to share the cake. She uses the knife to trace lines in the icing. The others watch her. She does not cut the cake yet. The others must first agree if her way is fair.

"I think I will cut two slices, like this. Now we have three slices, all the same!" Maya shows them.
text: 瑪雅是第一個分配蛋糕的。她先用刀在蛋奶油上劃線。其他人都靜靜地看著她。她動手切蛋糕前，其他孩子必須首先同意她的分配方式，看看是否公平。「我想我會先切兩片，像這樣。再把一片切成三片，瞧！現在我們有一樣大小的三片！」 瑪雅向他們展示她的分配方式。

SourceText: Keep watching the strawberries on top of the cake. There are six of them now, but it will keep changing. Where do they go?
text: 繼續觀察蛋糕頂部的草莓。現在有一共六顆，但數量會一直變化。它們去哪裡了？

SourceText: There are some more rectangles in this picture. Can you find parts of them?
text: 在這張圖片中還有一些矩形的東西。你能找到嗎？

SourceText: Notice which children wear hats. That will keep changing too! Is the author having fun with us, or is something else going on?
text: 請注意看看哪些孩子戴著帽子。這一狀態也會改變！到底是作者在和我們開玩笑，還是有其他事情發生？

SourceText: "No way!" says Duksie, "the one in the middle is much too big!" Doobie also shakes his head. Maya laughs and shrugs and tells Duksie to try.
text: 「這不行！」 達西說，「中間那塊太大了！」 多彼也搖了搖頭。瑪雅笑了笑，聳了聳肩，並告訴達西不如讓他試試分蛋糕。

SourceText: There are three pieces for three people. Is this a fair way to cut the cake?
text: 這樣的三塊蛋糕讓三個人一起分享。你覺得這樣的方式公平嗎？

SourceText: When some pieces have more topping or icing, it can be hard to divide something fairly. It is good to be among friends when it is difficult like that.
text: 三塊蛋糕中，某塊蛋糕上面可能有更多的奶油及裝飾物，要公平分配則會變的非常困難。有時候跟朋友一起面對這樣的難題也是一件好事。

SourceText: When you have trouble sharing something equally, how do you work it out?
text: 當你遇到無法將某種東西平均分配時，你是如何解決這個難題的？

SourceText: "Here! Pass me the knife, I'll do it. Easy peasy!" chants Duksie. First she rubs out Maya's pattern in the icing and licks her fingers.
text: 「把刀遞給我，我來分。小菜一碟對我來說！」 達西說著。她先把瑪雅在蛋奶油上畫的線條擦掉，還舔了舔手指。

SourceText: Look at their faces. How can you tell they might not all agree with this new sharing idea?
text: 請看看孩子們的表情。你是怎麼知道他們不是所有人都同意達西的新分配方案呢？

SourceText: There are lots of round shapes in this picture. When a circle gets stretched or shrunk in one direction, it is called an oval or an ellipse. Find some circles and ovals in this picture.
text: 這張圖片中有很多圓形。當一個圓形的一個方向上被拉伸或收縮時，它被稱為橢圓。請看一看這張圖片中是否能找到一些圓形和橢圓的物體。

SourceText: Sometimes our point of view distorts a shape and makes it look different, even though it hasn't changed at all. For example, circles can look like ovals when viewed from the side. Do you see some examples of that around you?
text: 有時候，我們的視角會扭曲一個我物體形狀，讓它看起來和該有的樣子不太一樣，儘管它實際上並沒有被改變。例如，圓圈如果從側面看， 可能看起來像橢圓。你周圍是否找到一些相似的例子呢？

SourceText:
Then she makes one cut across and one down, "Look, these are my three slices!"

"That's not fair!" shout Maya and Doobie together.
text:
然後，她用刀子橫著來一刀，豎著來一刀，「看，這是我分的三塊！」

「不公平！」瑪雅和多彼異口同聲地喊道。

SourceText: If you had a choice, which piece would you choose? When one piece is obviously the best or the worst, the sharing is probably not fair!
text: 如果讓你選，你會選擇哪一塊？當某一塊蛋糕明顯比其他要大的時候，是不可能實現公平分配的！

SourceText: Duksie did it this way because it was easy to do. She split it once in half and then split one of those two pieces in half. Unfortunately, that created one piece that was twice as big as the other two pieces.
text: 達西這樣做是方法很簡單。她先把蛋糕分成兩半，然後再把其中一塊分成兩半，結果造成了一塊是其他兩塊的兩倍。

SourceText: When you split something into two equal pieces, each piece is one half. When you split one half into two equal pieces, then each piece is one fourth, also called one quarter.
text: 當你把一樣東西分成兩等份時，每份是一半。當你把其中一半在分成兩份時，每份就是原始狀態的四等份之一，也稱為四分之一。

SourceText:
"Share it fair! The pieces must be the same size and shape," adds Doobie.

"Why don't you try Doobie?" smirks Duksie. "I bet you can't do it!"
text: 「公平分配！那意味著每一塊必須是相同大小和形狀，」 多彼補充道。 \PARA 「那麼多彼不如你試試分蛋糕？」 達西嘲笑地道。「我打賭你做不到！」

SourceText: If you split something into three equal pieces, each piece is one third of the whole thing. Have you figured out how to give each child one third, or do you think it is impossible?
text: 如果你把某物分成三等份，每份就是整體的三分之一。你想出了如何讓每個孩子得到三分之一的方法，還是覺得這是無法做到的？

SourceText: There were five strawberries on the top of the cake in the last page. How can you share five things evenly among three people?
text: 在上一頁的蛋糕上有一共有五顆草莓。你知道如何讓三人平分五件東西嗎？

SourceText: Look at Duksie's expression and listen to what Duksie said to Doobie. What do you think Duksie is feeling?
text: 看看達西的表情，聽聽她對多彼說了些什麼。你認為達西現在的感覺如何？

SourceText: "I wish the cake was a square or a rectangle, and then it would be easy!" says Doobie thoughtfully. "Or, if there were four of us to share the round cake that would also be easy," says Maya.
text: 「我多麼希望這蛋糕是一個正方形或矩形的，那樣就太容易了！」 多彼想了想說。「或者，如果有四個人一起分享這個圓蛋糕，那也很簡單，」 瑪雅說道。

SourceText: Doobie is doing some thoughtful problem solving! He is thinking of simpler versions of this problem that he knows how to solve. If any of those versions were enough like this situation, he could use that prior knowledge to solve this problem.
text: 多彼正在認真思考這個問題的解決方法！他在思考他是否解決過簡化版的問題。如果這種情況跟他以前面對過的一樣，他可以利用以前的知識和經驗來解決這個問題。

SourceText: Because he hasn't seen a problem just like this one before, he must use another important problem solving skill -- he persists! The other children rushed to a solution, but he is thinking about it more carefully.
text: 因為他以前從來沒有面對過完全相同的問題，所以他必須使用另一種解決問題的技能——堅持不懈！其他孩子著急的想要解決方法，但他卻在耐心的剖析問題。

SourceText: Doobie is playing with the problem and thinking about shapes that are similar to this round cake that needs to be split three ways. He is enjoying the puzzle!
text: 多彼正在思考與這個需要被三等分的圓形蛋糕相似的形狀。他正在享受解題！

SourceText:
And then, a picture comes into Doobie's head. He sees the sparkling silver badge at the front of his father's big red truck.

On Sundays he helps his dad to wash the truck, and to polish the shiny badge. "I've got it! I've got it! I know how to do it," yells Doobie.
text:
突然間，多彼腦海中浮現出一個畫面。他想起了父親大紅卡車前閃閃發光的銀色徽章。 

每個星期天，他都會幫爸爸一起洗卡車，並把徽章擦得亮閃閃發光。「我想到了！我想到了！我知道怎麼做了！」 多彼大聲地叫道。

SourceText: He persisted and he played with the problem, and his thoughts came to a shape that he knew would be perfect to solve this problem. Look at how happy he is. Describe how you feel when you solve something that was tricky.
text: 通過他堅持不懈地思考，他終於想到了一個完美的解決方法。描述下當你解決了一個棘手難題時的感覺。

SourceText: There are rectangles, triangles, circles, stripes, and arcs (partial circles) in this picture.
text: 這張圖片中有矩形、三角形、圓形、條紋和弧（部分圓）等形狀。

SourceText: What do you suppose creates the stripes on the far hillside?
text: 你認為是哪些線條形成了遠處山坡上的紋路？

SourceText: First he uses a knife to smooth Duksie's lines in the icing. Then he traces three lines on the cake. It looks just like the badge on his dad's truck, with three equal parts.
text: 首先，他用刀子抹平了之前在蛋糕上畫的線條。然後，他在蛋糕上畫了三條線。形成的圖案看起來就像他父親卡車上的徽章，蛋糕被分成了三等份。

SourceText: There were originally six strawberries on this cake. How many strawberries were removed? Where did they go?
text: 這個蛋糕上最初有六顆草莓。有多少草莓被拿掉了？它們去哪裡了？

SourceText: What are some numbers that can be divided evenly among three people? Notice that those numbers are exactly the ones you get as you skip count by 3. They are called multiples of 3 because they are the numbers you get when you multiply by 3.
text: 某些數字是可以被3整除的？你發現是哪一些數字了嗎？正是你通過3的跳數計數時得到的數字。它們被稱為3的倍數，因為它們是你通過某數乘以3後得到的數字。

SourceText: What are the numbers you can divide evenly among 2 people? Among 4 people? Among 5 people?
text: 你可以將什麼數量的物品平均地分給2個人？或者4個人？或者5個人？

SourceText: "You are full of surprises, Doobie," says Duksie sweetly. "How did you work it out?" Maya asks. Doobie smiles to himself. For now it is his secret. Later, he will tell his dad.
text: 「多彼！你真是個令人驚喜的家伙,」 達西甜蜜地說。「你是怎麼想到這個解決方法的？」 瑪雅問道。多彼微笑，想暫時保密，遲些他再告訴爸爸。

SourceText: It can be fun to have a secret. What's a secret you once had that is no longer a secret?
text: 保守秘密是很有趣的。你過去有是否有一個秘密，但現在已經不再是秘密了？

SourceText: There is a lot of pink icing in many places in this picture. The oddest place is on someone's nose. How do you suppose it got there?
text: 這張圖片中很多地方都有粉色的蛋奶油。最奇怪的地方是有人的鼻子上竟然會有奶油。你覺得奶油是怎麼弄上去的？

SourceText: Look at how big their eyes are. What does it tell you when someone has big eyes like that?
text: 看看他們的大眼睛。如果有人把眼睛張得這麼大，你覺得是想傳達什麼信息呢？

SourceText:
Just then Mama K comes out of her house. She is carrying a tray with glasses of strawberry juice. "Look Mama K! Doobie found the way to cut the cake into three equal pieces," Maya tells her.

"Well done Doobie, three equal slices! You shared fairly, I'm proud of you all. Now cut the cake and drink your juice. It's time to go home."
text:
就在這時，柯媽媽從她的房子走了出來。手裡拿著一托盤裝，托盤上有裝著草莓汁的玻璃杯。「看啊，那是柯媽媽！多彼想到了把蛋糕切成三等份的方法,」 瑪雅告訴她。

「多彼，幹得非常好，三等份的蛋糕！你們分配得很公平，我為你們感到驕傲。現在是時候切蛋糕，喝果汁，差不多是時候回家了。」

SourceText: They are all wearing their hats on this page. Do you like wearing a hat on a warm, sunny day? Do you have a favorite hat?
text: 這一頁上的他們都戴著帽子。你喜歡在溫暖的陽光明媚的日子裡戴帽子嗎？你是否有喜歡的帽子呢？

SourceText: Why is Mama K proud of all of them? What difficult thing did they do?
text: 為什麼柯媽媽會為他們感到驕傲？他們面對了什麼困難的事情？

SourceText: An estimate is a best guess at the size of something that is not easy to measure. What is your estimate of the number of dots on Mama K's dress?
text: 估算是對不容易計數的東西的最佳猜測。你估算一下柯媽媽的裙子上有多少個點？

SourceText: Maya cuts along Doobie's lines to make three equal slices. Just for fun, the children stack the slices on top of each other to check that they are the same size. Yes they are! They pack their cake to take home.
text: 瑪雅沿著多彼的線切蛋糕，把蛋糕分成了三份一樣大小的蛋糕。為了好玩，孩子們把三片蛋糕上下疊在一起来檢查它們大小是否相同。結果，蛋糕真的是相同大小的！他們包好蛋糕準備帶回家。

SourceText: They are staring very intently at the cake. Are they admiring their work of creating three equal shares, or are they wishing they could eat it?
text: 他們都非常認真地盯著蛋糕。你覺得他們是在欣賞他們分配好的三份同等蛋糕，還是想快點把蛋糕吃掉？

SourceText: Look at how much pleasure they have at seeing that their solution really works. Problem solving is like that – you have a puzzle to think about and wrestle with, and when you solve the puzzle it feels really good!
text: 看看他們在找到的可行的解決方案時有多高興啊。解決問題就是這樣——你要思考如何解決謎題，當你解決了這個難題時，會感覺很好！

SourceText: Think of a time when you had a tricky puzzle to figure out and you finally solved it. How did it feel when you got the answer?
text: 回想一下過去你解決的一個謎題，你最後成功破解了這個謎題。在你得到答案時的感覺是什麼樣的？

SourceText:
Doobie's dad arrives to pick up the children, and Doobie runs off to meet him.

He can't wait to tell his dad how the badge on the truck helped him to solve a very tricky problem!
text:
多彼的爸爸來接孩子們了，多彼跑過去迎接他。

他迫不及待地告訴他爸爸他如何利用卡車上的徽章來幫助他解決一個非常棘手的問題！

SourceText: It's fun to share successes with someone you care about and who cares about you. Can you think of some things you were proud of that you shared with someone you cared about?
text: 與關心你或你關心的人分享你的成功是很有滿足感的。你過去有把你感到驕傲的事情分享給你關心的人們嗎？

SourceText: Those same people are important for times when you need someone to share something hard for you. Can you think of such a time?
text: 當你需要有人分享一些對你來說困難的事情時，這些人同樣重要。你能想到這樣的時刻嗎？

SourceText: The top two cakes on the next page are easy to share with three or six people. If you were sharing the bottom cake with three or five people, what would you do?
text: 下一頁有兩個蛋糕要與三個或六個人分享很容易。但是如果你要與三個或五個人分享那兩個蛋糕你會怎麼分配呢？

SourceText:
How many cats? 

 0 Zero cats.

No cats here!
text:
有多少只貓？

0 零只貓。

這裏沒有貓！

SourceText: 0 is an important number! It's where all counting starts, even when we don't say it.
text: 0是一個重要的數字！這是所有計算開始的地方，即使我們不把它說出來。

SourceText: How many cats do you see?
text: 你看到多少只貓？

SourceText: Count together the butterflies – they are tricky to find in this picture.
text: 數一數蝴蝶們——在這張圖片裏很難找到它們。

SourceText:
How many cats? 

 1 One cat.

 A black cat is eating red meat.
text:
有多少只貓？

1 一只貓。 

一只黑貓正在吃紅肉。

SourceText: Point to and name the green and orange squares, blue shirt, and black cat.
text: 指出並說出綠色和橙色的方塊，藍色的襯衫和黑貓。

SourceText: Notice how Paul is looking at the cat. Paul sure likes cats!
text: 註意保羅是怎麽看著貓的。保羅肯定喜歡貓！

SourceText: Each time a cat is added: a) say that one more than the last number of cats is the new number, and b) one less than the current number is the last number.
text: 每次添加一只貓時：1）說新數量是上次貓的數量加一，2）上次數量是當前數量減一。

SourceText:
How many cats? 

 2 Two cats. 

 A white cat and a grey cat are sleeping.
text:
有多少只貓？

2 兩只貓。

一只白貓和一只灰貓在睡覺。

SourceText: Count together the cats, plants, and people.
text: 數一數貓、植物和人。

SourceText: Of cats, plants, and people, which number is the biggest? Which one is the smallest?
text: 在貓、植物和人當中，哪個數字最大？哪一個是最小的？

SourceText: Notice that the square tiles are now all the same gray color.
text: 註意這些正方形瓷磚現在都是相同的灰色。

SourceText:
How many cats? 

3 Three cats. 

Three cats are playing in the kitchen.
text:
有多少只貓？

3 三只貓。

三只貓在廚房裏玩。

SourceText: What a mess! There must be zero people here!
text: 真是一團糟！ 這裏肯定一個人都沒有！

SourceText: Count together each group – the cats, cabinet doors, food containers, and spoons.
text: 數一數每一組——貓、櫥櫃門、食物容器和勺子。

SourceText: Which thing is there the most of in this picture?
text: 在這張圖中哪一樣東西最多？

SourceText:
How many cats? 

4 Four cats. 

Four cats are Paul's friends.
text:
有多少只貓？

4 四只貓。

四只貓是保羅的朋友。

SourceText: Count all the cats.
text: 數一數所有的貓。

SourceText: Which of these cats have you seen before, and which are new? Which ones are missing?
text: 這些貓中哪些你以前見過，哪些是新的？少了哪些？

SourceText: Point at and name all the different colors in the room.
text: 指著房間裏所有不同的顏色並說出它們的名稱。

SourceText:
How many cats? 

5 Five cats. 

Five cats chase the dog.
text:
有多少只貓？

5 五只貓。

五只貓追那只狗。

SourceText: Looking at their faces and bodies, do the cats and the dog like each other?
text: 看著他們的臉和身體，貓和狗彼此喜歡對方嗎？

SourceText: Count the number of cats and the number of dogs. Which group is bigger? Poor dog!
text: 數一數貓和狗的數量。哪一組的數量更大？可憐的狗！

SourceText: These cats all have different coloring. Describe the color and pattern of each cat.
text: 這些貓的顏色都不同。描述每只貓的顏色和斑紋。

SourceText:
How many cats?

6 Six cats.

Six cats waiting for the dog.
text:
有多少只貓？

6 六只貓。

六只貓等待著那只狗。

SourceText: Count the cats on the floor and in the picture. Is it the same number?
text: 數一數地板上和圖畫裏的貓。是同一個數字嗎？

SourceText: Find a cat or two in the picture on the wall that is not on the floor.
text: 在墻上的圖片中找一只或兩只不在地板上的貓。

SourceText: The dog doesn't want to come back. Why not?
text: 那只狗不想回來。為什麼不想呢？

SourceText:
How many cats? 

7 Seven cats. 

Seven cats playing in the compound.
text:
有多少只貓？

7 七只貓。

七只貓在院子裏玩耍。

SourceText: Point at each of the seven cats.
text: 指出七只貓中的每一只。

SourceText: What is Paul looking for?
text: 保羅在找什麼？

SourceText: The cat on the roof is the highest cat. How did that cat get up so high?
text: 屋頂上的貓是最高的貓。那只貓是如何爬到這麽高的？

SourceText:
How many cats? 

8 Eight cats. 

Eight cats and one dog!
text:
有多少只貓？

8 八只貓。

八只貓和一只狗！

SourceText: The cats have many different colors and patterns. Have you seen cats like these?
text: 這些貓有許多不同的顏色和斑紋。你見過這樣的貓嗎？

SourceText: Seven cats plus one dog makes how many animals?
text: 七只貓加一只狗等於多少只動物？

SourceText: Do you think the dog looks happy or worried?
text: 你認為這只狗看起來是高興還是擔心？

SourceText:
A kitten is stuck in a tree! 

"I will rescue you!" says Paul.
text:
一只小貓被卡在樹上了！

「我來救你！」保羅說。

SourceText: How many cats are stuck in the tree?
text: 有多少只貓被困在樹上？

SourceText: How did the cat get up there?
text: 那只貓是如何爬上去的？

SourceText: The cat is higher than Paul. How will Paul help the cat?
text: 這只貓比保羅高。保羅將如何幫助這只貓？

SourceText:
Mama, can we keep him?" 

How many cats? 

9 Nine cats. 

"That is too many cats!" says Mama.
text:
「媽媽，我們能留下他嗎？」

有多少只貓？

9 九只貓。

媽媽說：「這太多貓了！」

SourceText: One more than eight cats is nine cats. A dog and nine cats is how many animals?
text: 比八只貓多一只就是九只貓。一只狗和九只貓是多少只動物？

SourceText: Do you know anyone with cats? How many cats do they have?
text: 你認識養貓的人嗎？他們有多少只貓？

SourceText: Do you think nine cats is too many?
text: 你覺得九只貓太多了嗎？

SourceText: It had been raining for days, and everyone was grumpy. Everyone except Sizwe, who woke up with a smile every morning. "Yoh! Sizwe! That smile is magic!" said Gogo. "Is it for me?" Sizwe clapped his hand over his mouth. "But it's MY smile, Gogo," he whispered.
text: 雨已經連續下了好幾天，每個人都顯得煩躁不安。除了希茲韋，他每天早上醒來時都帶著微笑。「哇！希茲韋！那個微笑真是神奇！」戈戈說道。「這是為我準備的嗎？」希茲韋用手捂住嘴巴，低聲說：「但這是我的微笑啊，戈戈。」

SourceText: The colors on this page are muted, they are not very bright. How do muted colors make you feel? The muted colors are in strong contrast to Sizwe's bright smile, and they help us notice the smile.
text: 這一頁的顏色是柔和的，並不十分鮮豔。柔和的顏色讓你感覺如何？這些柔和的色彩與希茲韋明亮的微笑形成強烈對比，幫助我們注意到他的笑容。

SourceText: There are lots of shapes here. A rectangle is a 4-side figure shaped like this page. Though it is a bit rounded, the side of his bed is a rectangle. His eyes are circles. The neckline of his shirt is a partial circle, which is called an arc.
text: 這裡有許多形狀。矩形是一個四邊形，就像這一頁的形狀。雖然有點圓潤，但他的床邊也是一個矩形。他的眼睛是圓形，而他的襯衫領口則是一個部分圓形，稱為弧線。

SourceText: Point out all the arcs in this picture, don't forget the small ones, and then look around where you are to find some more arcs.
text: 指出這張圖片中的所有弧線，別忘了那些小的弧線，然後看看你周圍，找找還有哪些弧線。

SourceText: His mother laughed. "Sizwe! A smile is something you can give away without losing it. Look!" She lifted him up to the mirror. There was his smile, just as bright as before.
text: 他的母親笑了。「希茲韋！微笑是可以送給別人而不會失去的東西。你看！」她把他抱到鏡子前。鏡子裡依然是他那燦爛的笑容，和之前一樣明亮。

SourceText: The colors on this page are a bit brighter. Which colors on this page are the brightest?
text: 這一頁的顏色稍微明亮了一些。這一頁上最亮的顏色是什麼？

SourceText: The mirror is round, but it is not a circle. A circle that is stretched or squished is called an oval or an ellipse. Look around you. Do you see rectangles, circles, arcs, and ovals?
text: 鏡子是圓形的，但它不是一個正圓。一個被拉長或壓扁的圓形被稱為橢圓形。看看你周圍，你能看到矩形、圓形、弧線和橢圓形嗎？

SourceText: A smile is something you can give away without losing it or using it up. Can you think of other things like this?
text: 微笑是一種可以送給別人而不會失去或用完的東西。你能想到其他類似的東西嗎？

SourceText: It was time to go out. Mama buttoned up Sizwe's raincoat, and off they went, through the rain, to the library. Down the street, Sizwe's best friend Zanele stood at the window of her house, looking sadly at the rain. Sizwe felt his smile creeping, creeping up. Before he knew it, his smile LEAPT out, and flew across the garden to Zanele.
text: 該出門了。媽媽幫希茲韋扣好雨衣，他們冒著雨前往圖書館。沿著街道走去，希茲韋最好的朋友扎內萊站在她家的窗邊，憂鬱地望著雨。希茲韋感覺到他的微笑悄悄地、悄悄地浮現。還沒等他反應過來，他的微笑已經跳了出來，飛過花園，傳遞給了扎內萊。

SourceText: How does Zanele feel? How can you tell from the picture that Zanele feels that way?
text: 扎內萊的感受如何？你如何從圖片中看出扎內萊的感覺？

SourceText: Zanele's dog looks concerned about Zanele. Do you have an animal or person who is good at noticing when you are sad? Do they try to cheer you up?
text: 扎內萊的狗看起來很關心她。你是否有動物或朋友能察覺到你難過的時候？他們會試著讓你開心嗎？

SourceText: Notice how the arcs of Zanele's mouth, eyes, and eyebrows are all turned down and sagging. Describe how these arcs change when someone is happy and smiling.
text: 注意扎內萊的嘴巴、眼睛和眉毛的弧線都向下垂。描述一下當一個人快樂微笑時，這些弧線會如何變化。

SourceText: Zanele held on tightly to the smile – it was far too precious to let it get away. As Sizwe walked away to the library, Zanele's doorbell rang. It was the postman, with a letter from her favorite cousin. Zanele was so happy, that the smile bounced up, and beamed out at the postman. "Thank you, Mister Postman!" she said.
text: 扎內萊緊緊抓住那個微笑——它太珍貴了，不能讓它溜走。當希茲韋走向圖書館時，扎內萊的門鈴響了。是郵差，帶著她最喜歡的表哥寄來的信。扎內萊非常開心，微笑跳了起來，並向郵差綻放。「謝謝你，郵差先生！」她說。

SourceText: How does it make you feel when you get a message from someone you like? Do you ever send messages to people you like to cheer them up?
text: 當你收到喜歡的人的消息時，你有什麼感覺？你是否曾經發送消息給你喜歡的人來讓他們開心？

SourceText: What are the bright colors in this picture? On grey days, it can take a little extra effort to find bright colors and celebrate them.
text: 這張圖片中的明亮顏色是什麼？在灰暗的日子裡，找到明亮的顏色並慶祝它們可能需要多一點努力。

SourceText: It looks like the Postman is about twice as tall as Zanele. We could say he is two Zaneles in height. People sometimes measure things in terms of people. They will say that it is 100 steps to get somewhere or that ocean waves are waist high.
text: 看起來郵差的身高大約是扎內萊的兩倍。我們可以說他的身高是兩個扎內萊。人們有時會用人的身高來衡量事物。他們會說到達某個地方需要100步，或者海浪有腰部那麼高。

SourceText: Zanele's smile was the brightest thing the postman had seen all morning. It kept him warm as he trudged off through the rain. He came to a big house. Inside the gate, a dog was spinning around in circles, barking, barking, barking. He was so silly that the postman couldn't help smiling. The smile bounced through the gate with glitter of glee.
text: 扎內萊的微笑是郵差整個早上見過最明亮的東西。當他冒雨艱難前行時，這個微笑讓他感到溫暖。他來到一棟大房子前。門內，一隻狗正轉著圈，不停地吠叫。牠的樣子太滑稽了，郵差忍不住笑了起來。微笑帶著閃閃的喜悅，跳進了門內。

SourceText: Zanele's smile was a wonderful gift to the postman, and from there it became a happy gift to the dog. Is the smile getting worn out, or is it just as powerful as when it started with Sizwe?
text: 扎內萊的微笑對郵差來說是一份美妙的禮物，而從那裡開始，它又變成了給狗的快樂禮物。這個微笑是否變得疲憊了，還是它仍然像最初從希茲韋開始時一樣充滿力量？

SourceText: What shapes do you see on this page? There are lots of rectangles, and there are quite a few interesting curves.
text: 你在這一頁上看到了哪些形狀？這裡有許多矩形，還有一些有趣的曲線。

SourceText: Counting the rectangles here can be tricky because you get a new rectangle when you put two rectangles side by side. There are over 20 rectangles if you count them all!
text: 計算這裡的矩形可能會有點棘手，因為當你把兩個矩形並排放置時，會形成一個新的矩形。如果你仔細數，會發現這裡有超過20個矩形！

SourceText: The dog stopped barking. He pricked up his ears and wagged his tail. Then he turned and ran back to the house with the precious, warm smile. A bent old man opened the door. "Oh, no! You can't come inside. You're all wet!" he told the dog. But right away, the smile beamed up at the old man.
text: 狗停止了吠叫。牠豎起耳朵，搖著尾巴。然後，牠轉身帶著那珍貴而溫暖的微笑跑回了房子。一位彎腰駝背的老人打開了門。「哦，不行！你不能進來，你全身都濕透了！」他對狗說。但立刻，微笑向老人綻放。

SourceText: It is amazing how much more people like to do nice things when they are feeling happy. Do you notice it's easier to be thoughtful and kind when you are feeling good?
text: 當人們感到快樂時，他們更願意做善事，這真是令人驚奇。你是否注意到，當你心情愉快時，更容易體貼和友善？

SourceText: The world would be a much better place if everyone could feel happy all the time. Do you think that is possible?
text: 如果每個人都能一直感到快樂，世界會變得更加美好。你認為這可能嗎？

SourceText: The light vertical lines going up and down show us that it is raining. These lines are all going in the same direction. A family of lines like this are said to be parallel. Parallel lines never meet, no matter how far out they go!
text: 垂直的細線顯示正在下雨。這些線都朝著同一個方向延伸。這樣的一組線被稱為平行線。平行線永遠不會相交，無論它們延伸多遠！

SourceText: The old man stood a little straighter. "Eish," he said, "Who cares if it's raining? Let's go for a walk, boy!" And off they went, splashing in the puddles. There, at the zebra crossing, stood grumpy Mrs. Makabela, the traffic cop. She looked cold, and wet, and miserable. The old man knew just what to do. "Morning, Mrs. Makabela!" he called, and smiled his biggest, brightest smile. But Mrs. Makabela did not smile back.
text: 老人站得更直了一些。「哎呀，」他說，「誰在乎下雨呢？我們去散步吧，小子！」於是他們出發了，踩著水坑前進。在斑馬線旁，站著脾氣暴躁的交通警察馬卡貝拉太太。她看起來又冷又濕，還很沮喪。老人知道該怎麼做。「早上好，馬卡貝拉太太！」他喊道，並露出了他最燦爛的笑容。但馬卡貝拉太太並沒有回以微笑。

SourceText: Some people avoid puddles on rainy days. However, it's a lot more fun to splash in them! Do you like to do that?
text: 有些人在雨天會避開水坑，但踩水坑其實更有趣！你喜歡這樣做嗎？

SourceText: What things in this picture show us how Mrs. Makabela is feeling?
text: 這張圖片中的哪些細節顯示了馬卡貝拉太太的感受？

SourceText: Which shapes do you see in this picture? Are there any new ones here?
text: 你在這張圖片中看到了哪些形狀？這裡有沒有新的形狀？

SourceText: Standing in the rain for days can make a face sad, sad, sad. But a smile is a magical thing and, by now, the smile was so strong, and so bright, that it was very hard to keep inside. It didn't work right away, but bit by tiny bit, it began to creep out until, at last!
text: 在雨中站了幾天，會讓一張臉變得無比沮喪。但微笑是一種神奇的東西，而現在，這個微笑是如此強烈、如此明亮，以至於難以被隱藏。它並沒有立刻起作用，但一點一滴地，它開始悄悄流露，直到最後！

SourceText: There is no picture on this page to tell us what is going on. What do you think is happening in the story right now? What will happen next?
text: 這一頁沒有圖片來告訴我們發生了什麼。你認為故事現在進行到哪裡了？接下來會發生什麼？

SourceText: How do you think the story will end? Will all the smiles get used up?
text: 你覺得故事會如何結束？所有的微笑會被用完嗎？

SourceText: Smiling and being happy is one emotion. Choose another emotion and make up a story about how someone with that emotion changed the lives of the people around them.
text: 微笑和快樂是一種情緒。選擇另一種情緒，編一個故事，講述一個擁有這種情緒的人如何改變了周圍人的生活。

SourceText: A great, big smile lit up Mrs. Makabela's face! The school bell rang, and children ran to cross the road. Mrs. Makabela put up her sign, and smiled, and smiled, at each and every child.
text: 一個燦爛的笑容點亮了馬卡貝拉太太的臉龐！學校的鈴聲響起，孩子們跑來過馬路。馬卡貝拉太太舉起她的標誌，對每一個孩子微笑，再微笑。

SourceText: Look at how the stripes on the street are made from a series of alternating black and white rectangles.
text: 看看馬路上的條紋是如何由一系列黑白相間的矩形組成的。

SourceText: Ever wonder whether zebras are black with white stripes or whether they are white with black stripes (they are black with white stripes)? Most roads are black, so it's very likely that these are white stripes on top of a black road.
text: 你是否曾經好奇斑馬是黑色帶白色條紋，還是白色帶黑色條紋？（其實是黑色帶白色條紋。）大多數道路都是黑色的，所以這些很可能是黑色路面上畫的白色條紋。

SourceText: The story uses the two words "smiled" and "child" that sound alike -- they rhyme. Having rhyming words makes the story feel cheery and fun. Say some rhyming words that you think are fun to hear together.
text: 故事中使用了兩個發音相似的詞語——「微笑」和「孩子」，它們押韻。押韻的詞語讓故事聽起來更加歡快有趣。說一些你覺得聽起來很有趣的押韻詞吧。

SourceText: The children smiled at their moms and dads, and their gogos and tatas and brothers and sisters. They smiled at the bus driver and the greengrocer, and Mme. Makau, who went off to smile at her husband, who smiled at the mayor. The smiles leapt and rolled and beamed and gleamed until EVERYONE was smiling and giggling and laughing out loud in the rain.
text: 孩子們對他們的爸爸媽媽、爺爺奶奶、兄弟姐妹微笑。他們對公車司機、蔬果店老闆微笑，還有馬考太太，她也去對她的丈夫微笑，而她的丈夫又對市長微笑。這些微笑跳躍、滾動、閃耀、發光，直到「每個人」都在雨中微笑、咯咯笑，甚至大聲笑出來。

SourceText: There is no limit to how much smiles can bounce around. How marvelous that all that smiling and laughing can happen on a rainy day.
text: 微笑的傳遞是沒有極限的。多麼奇妙啊，所有的微笑和笑聲竟然發生在一個雨天。
